commit_message:
Remove python-qpid-proton 0.14.0 build

At least one distro (ubuntu xenial)
does not have the necessary packages in its default repositories
for building python-qpid-proton 0.14.0 (libqpid-proton2-dev doesn't provide
the necessary qpid-proton required in the wheel build).

When building the wheel, the bundling of qpid-proton fails
due to apache mirrors having removed this old version.

This prevents the newton branch to build.

Example pip wheel log:
```
Collecting python-qpid-proton===0.14.0 (from -r requirements.txt (line 1))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/4e/af/d39f0e805f8d76f9683d2832e456b9adffde3f56dda8ebc0eae03d2647f6/python-qpid-proton-0.14.0.tar.gz
Building wheels for collected packages: python-qpid-proton
  Running setup.py bdist_wheel for python-qpid-proton ... error
  Complete output from command /usr/bin/python -u -c (redacted)
  running bdist_wheel
  running build
  running build_ext
  running configure
  Did not find libqpid-proton via pkg-config:
  Bundling qpid-proton into the extension
  fetching http://www.apache.org/dist/qpid/proton/0.14.0/qpid-proton-0.14.0.tar.gz into build/bundled
  error: HTTP Error 404: Not Found
```

Change-Id: I1b3708da4cefa7e15ec5f5623e182a3258508fc7

subject: This patch is to fix the bug that a loadbalancer that has been PENDING_CREATE status can not be deleted througth REST API or CLI.
messages:
[{'account_id': 27487, 'date': '2019-02-15 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-02-15 16:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

This will cause failures and resources to be left in use.
All PENDING_* statuses mean that one of the controller processes still has the resource locked and is actively working on the resource. Once the controller succeeds or if it expires the number of retries attempting the operation, it will move the resource either into ACTIVE or ERROR status.'}]

commit_message:
This patch is to fix the bug that a loadbalancer that has been PENDING_CREATE
status can not be deleted througth REST API or CLI.

Change-Id: Ieab1af685261522e51625742350f815c86e677bb
Story: 2005026

> I am trying to understand if we need to put EFI image into the file system ironic builds....

Turned out, that `mkisofs` wants these boot images to be present on the filesystem no matter what. But you can ask `mkisofs` to "hide" these files from view.

Anyway, I propose to drop legacy syslinux boot loader from UEFI-bootable ISOs we build. Unless I miss something important -- why do we build either BIOS-only or UEFI+BIOS ISOs...?

WDYT?'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-12-07 16:44:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-02-08 13:55:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> It would be good if we could get documentation changed as well in this patch or a follow-up patch.

TL;DR; The documentation will come along with the vmedia feature for the redfish hw type.

This patch is a prerequisite for the redfish vmedia implementation. This code is currently  used by the ilo and irmc vmedia drivers. The original way how they deal with EFI remains intact and therefore no documentation change is necessary.

My plan is to make redfish vmedia primarily using stand-alone EFI image for efficiency reasons. That's why this patch. May be redfish should also support EFI image extraction from IPA image (i.e. the way how ilo/irmc work)? But then the operator needs to have proper IPA ISO...

At any rate, I plan to land the documentation on EFI image deal along with the redfish vmedia patch.

Does it make sense?"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-14 21:08:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-02-15 14:27:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(5 comments)

Follow up: https://review.openstack.org/637211'}]

This change allows supplying `efiboot.img` to the ISO image building

'}, {'created': '2018-12-07 15:35:08.000000000', 'message': 'Build ISO out of EFI system partition image

When ironic builds UEFI-bootable ISO image, it extracts

`deploy_iso` ISO image.

This change allows supplying EFI system partition image to
the ISO image building routines in form of a local file or
UUID or URI reference.

The motivation behind this change is to make UEFI-bootable image
building process more efficient and functional. This change is
thought of as a prerequisite for the upcoming Redfish-based
virtual media boot feature.

Also, this change makes ironic building UEFI-only bootable
ISO image (when being asked to build a UEFI-bootable image)
rather than building a hybrid BIOS/UEFI-bootable ISO. The
motivation behind this change is to make node booting more
predicable meaning that if user asks for UEFI boot, ironic
will either boot the node over UEFI or fail.

commit_message:
Build ISO out of EFI system partition image

When ironic builds UEFI-bootable ISO image, it extracts
EFI system partition image (`efiboot.img`) from the
`deploy_iso` ISO image.

This change allows supplying EFI system partition image to
the ISO image building routines in form of a local file or
UUID or URI reference.

The motivation behind this change is to make UEFI-bootable image
building process more efficient and functional. This change is
thought of as a prerequisite for the upcoming Redfish-based
virtual media boot feature.

Story: 1526753
Task: 28098
Change-Id: Idf912ff2146434b666fdb4250dc1ecad39bc5a04

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 12:24:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix HPE3PAR not returning cached stats

All Cinder drivers must honor this:

   stats = driver.get_volume_stats(refresh=True)
   cached_stats = driver.get_volume_stats(refresh=False)
   assert stats == cached_stats

But HPE 3PAR drivers don't.  If you try to get cached stats values
you'll get an empty dictionary instead.

This is caused by the get_volume_stats method calling the _login method
which in turn calls _init_common, which returns a new HPE3PARCommon
instance on each call, so it won't have any cached values.

Closes-Bug: #1813930
Change-Id: I011e7142db5d54882fd2cd9c07276ac71a07b4b7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix HPE3PAR not returning cached stats

All Cinder drivers must honor this:

   stats = driver.get_volume_stats(refresh=True)
   cached_stats = driver.get_volume_stats(refresh=False)
   assert stats == cached_stats

But HPE 3PAR drivers don't.  If you try to get cached stats values
you'll get an empty dictionary instead.

This is caused by the get_volume_stats method calling the _login method
which in turn calls _init_common, which returns a new HPE3PARCommon
instance on each call, so it won't have any cached values.

Closes-Bug: #1813930
Change-Id: I011e7142db5d54882fd2cd9c07276ac71a07b4b7

commit_message:
Adds resource_filters.json distribution

Cinder supposes to see resource_filters.json in
/etc/cinder/resource_filters.json, but role doesn't distribute this file
It implements generalized filters, w/o which non-admins will
experience problems with some operations (i.e in horizon).

Closes-Bug: #1810537
Change-Id: I0f699c9869effc5ccc0d3f79422935975f698134

According to the comments in link:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625630/8/cyborg/db/sqlalchemy/models.py
Fix the problems showed in the link. like: Add "deployable_id" field in

commit_message:
Fix New DB Schema problems.

According to the comments in link:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625630/8/cyborg/db/sqlalchemy/models.py
Fix the problems showed in the link. like: Add "deployable_id" field in
extended_accelerator_requests table, add "in_use"field in attach_handles table
etc.

Change-Id: I618ed466132e2ab0c8a02481367a117d793b2c8a

- py35/py36 jobs are failing
python 3.6 pycache also includes links - so those also
need to be removed by tox testenv

- kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source job is failing
Without basedir set in galera.cnf - mysql_install_db looks for resolveip
in /usr/sbin, instead of /usr/bin, thus complains about cannot resolving
neither $HOSTNAME, nor localhost.

Change-Id: I40514c0a7c43ae01c7680aac81123942be1cdef9
(cherry picked from commit 189af13ba68918181aaebb82d0e6257122ff8332)

commit_message:
Fix py35/py36 and k-a-ubuntu-source gate jobs

- py35/py36 jobs are failing
python 3.6 pycache also includes links - so those also
need to be removed by tox testenv

- kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source job is failing
Without basedir set in galera.cnf - mysql_install_db looks for resolveip
in /usr/sbin, instead of /usr/bin, thus complains about cannot resolving
neither $HOSTNAME, nor localhost.

Change-Id: I40514c0a7c43ae01c7680aac81123942be1cdef9
(cherry picked from commit 189af13ba68918181aaebb82d0e6257122ff8332)

commit_message:
Add MooseFS/MooseFS Pro Volume Driver

Add a volume driver which can use MooseFS.
MooseFS is an Open-source, POSIX-compliant distributed file system.
MooseFS aims to be fault-tolerant, highly available, highly
performing, scalable general-purpose network distributed file system
for data centers.
Driver has very similiar workflow to NFS, SMBFS or Virtuozzo.

Change-Id: Ieec97a8fb77d60ca80d2b1737f79e3134f83c8ed
Partially-Implements: driver-for-moosefs
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/572460

[{'account_id': 28389, 'date': '2018-06-05 16:37:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-05 16:38:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-05 16:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Not sure of our current policy on adding this. I know in the past we required CI running to support os-brick connectors.

Is an actual Cinder driver planned along with this? If so, make sure you have read over all the information in:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Cinder/how-to-contribute-a-driver

Since this appears to be open source, I believe the CI tests can be run by the openstack infra zuul jobs, but you would likely need to work with the infra team to see how to get that all set up.'}, {'account_id': 28389, 'date': '2018-06-12 18:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27710, 'date': '2018-06-12 19:08:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Michal, can you please add some explanation on the commit message on how this will interact with Cinder? (will it?)

Also you need to add unit tests to cover the new code you are adding. Please check the devref[1] documentation on how to do that. If you have any problem let us know. We are on the freenode #openstack-cinder channel.

Moose File System (MooseFS) is an Open-source, POSIX-compliant 
distributed file system. MooseFS aims to be fault-tolerant, highly 
available, highly performing, scalable general-purpose network distributed 
file system for data centers. Initially proprietary software, it 
was released to the public as open source on May 5, 2008.

Addded implementation allowing RemoteFsClient interact with mfsmount
to mount MooseFS share. It will allow to implement Cinder volume driver 
and Cinder backup driver for MooseFS.


Change-Id: I16a0e6e4eeadc5ce3da439763261bb427cb1d438

commit_message:
Added support for Moosefs

Added support for MooseFS filesystem, based on NFS Driver. Code build parse
given share name and calls mfsmount which is MooseFS FUSE client. It will
interact with Cinder allowing to develop MooseFS backup driver.

Change-Id: I16a0e6e4eeadc5ce3da439763261bb427cb1d438

commit_message:
Use the new limit option.

The nodes and roles options will be deprecated in future version on CLI
for upgrade and update run.

Change-Id: Ieac84692304248dbe3f6e2f1a97096b00690cd20
Closes-bug: #1815418

commit_message:
[Configuration] Remove the build documentation.

Remove the build of the documentation from tox, the project doesn't use
sphinx. That fix an error during the build of the documentation, because
the configuration file for sphinx is not found.

Change-Id: I577a05c2f7916bfca637ecb4451abbee5bd7714e

commit_message:
Ironic: report 0 for vcpus/memory_mb/disk_gb resources

Ironic nodes should all be using resource classes for scheduling by now,
which means reporting CPU/RAM/disk isn't useful. Report these as zero so
they cannot be scheduled.

Since we now require resource classes, raise an exception in
update_provider_tree for any nodes that don't have a resource class set
on the node.

Change-Id: If2b8c1a76d7dbabbac7bb359c9e572cfed510800

commit_message:
Fix py35/py36 and k-a-ubuntu-source gate jobs

- py35/py36 jobs are failing
python 3.6 pycache also includes links - so those also
need to be removed by tox testenv

- kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source job is failing
Without basedir set in galera.cnf - mysql_install_db looks for resolveip
in /usr/sbin, instead of /usr/bin, thus complains about cannot resolving
neither $HOSTNAME, nor localhost.

Change-Id: I40514c0a7c43ae01c7680aac81123942be1cdef9
(cherry picked from commit 189af13ba68918181aaebb82d0e6257122ff8332)

commit_message:
Fix py35/py36 and k-a-ubuntu-source gate jobs

- py35/py36 jobs are failing
python 3.6 pycache also includes links - so those also
need to be removed by tox testenv

- kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source job is failing
Without basedir set in galera.cnf - mysql_install_db looks for resolveip
in /usr/sbin, instead of /usr/bin, thus complains about cannot resolving
neither $HOSTNAME, nor localhost.

Change-Id: I40514c0a7c43ae01c7680aac81123942be1cdef9
(cherry picked from commit 189af13ba68918181aaebb82d0e6257122ff8332)

commit_message:
properly convey Keystone v3 params

To properly support Keystone V3, we must also properly convey the
domain information to the underlaying Keystone client.

Change-Id: I725e107e418d15b65aabf24f8c05403f952f94d5
story: 2005018
Task: 29497

commit_message:
Support parameters in Vitrage templates

A new option to define parameters inside Vitrage templates, and assign
them with actual values when adding the template.

This functionality is part of template version 2, and will be added to
template version 3 in the next patch set.

Documentation will be added in the next patch set.

Story: 2004056
Task: 27062

Change-Id: Iac163aaf6de0e029893386fc4274421df4706c4e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-09 12:46:21.000000000', 'message': 'instances.tests: Set return_value for tenant_absolute_limits

Previously tenant_absolute_limits was mocked but return_value
was not set properly. As a result, MagicMock() is compared to
an integer and this causes TypeError in python 3.

Change-Id: I4c912c77f28df816811b9bb1667629548f3998c4
Closes-Bug: #1815287
'}]
commit_message:
instances.tests: Set return_value for tenant_absolute_limits

Previously tenant_absolute_limits was mocked but return_value
was not set properly. As a result, MagicMock() is compared to
an integer and this causes TypeError in python 3.

Change-Id: I4c912c77f28df816811b9bb1667629548f3998c4
Closes-Bug: #1815287

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-10 15:37:57.000000000', 'message': 'pylint: fix cyclic-import

openstack_dashboard/api nova.py and cinder.py are imported
by each other. To avoid cyclic imports, some imports are placed
inside functions now, but it would be nice if we can move them
to a separate module and nova.py/cinder.py can import it.

This commit tries to achieve this by moving some stuffs in nova.py
into a separate module named _nova.py.
The module name starts with an underscore to clarify
it is intended to use only openstack_dashboard.api.

Change-Id: If91cf4f30d2ddab471757129c2a74b26b6d38b1e
'}, {'created': '2018-12-15 16:12:56.000000000', 'message': 'pylint: fix cyclic-import

openstack_dashboard/api nova.py and cinder.py are imported
by each other. To avoid cyclic imports, some imports are placed
inside functions now, but it would be nice if we can move them
to a separate module and nova.py/cinder.py can import it.

This commit tries to achieve this by moving some stuffs in nova.py
into a separate module named _nova.py.
The module name starts with an underscore to clarify
it is intended to use only openstack_dashboard.api.

commit_message:
pylint: fix cyclic-import

openstack_dashboard/api nova.py and cinder.py are imported
by each other. To avoid cyclic imports, some imports are placed
inside functions now, but it would be nice if we can move them
to a separate module and nova.py/cinder.py can import it.

This commit tries to achieve this by moving some stuffs in nova.py
into a separate module named _nova.py.
The module name starts with an underscore to clarify
it is intended to use only in openstack_dashboard.api.

Change-Id: If91cf4f30d2ddab471757129c2a74b26b6d38b1e

commit_message:
Ensure to call patch_middleware_get_user() in api.test_base

ApiHelperTests.test_url_for in openstack_dashboard.test.unit.api.test_base
depends on keystone user and token information. To make this work,
we need to call utils.patch_middleware_get_user().
This commit changes ApiHelperTests to inherit APITestCase.

Change-Id: I3848f756604262b07700a65e9be5bacd48da191f
Closes-Bug: #1815285

messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-10 00:15:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-02-12 14:40:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-02-13 06:07:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-02-15 04:49:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-02-15 13:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-10 00:15:12.000000000', 'message': 'Quote cinder qos-spec key name

In "Manage Specs" table of "Volume Types" panel, when a key name of
a QoS spec contains multiple spaces the QoS spec cannot be deleted
because multiple spaces in the key name are reduced into a single
space by the "minifyspace" templatetag.
"minifyspace" itself is useful, so it looks better to escape a key
name of a QoS spec to keep multiple spaces. This commit escapes
a key name of a QoS spec by using urllib.parse.quote().

Change-Id: Id11080e2a4284d69b8afb5c554728a98e024289f
Closes-Bug: #1811644
'}]
commit_message:
Quote cinder qos-spec key name

In "Manage Specs" table of "Volume Types" panel, when a key name of
a QoS spec contains multiple spaces the QoS spec cannot be deleted
because multiple spaces in the key name are reduced into a single
space by the "minifyspace" templatetag.
"minifyspace" itself is useful, so it looks better to escape a key
name of a QoS spec to keep multiple spaces. This commit escapes
a key name of a QoS spec by using urllib.parse.quote().

Change-Id: Id11080e2a4284d69b8afb5c554728a98e024289f
Closes-Bug: #1811644

commit_message:
Add a additional filter replace_underscores to filter the snapshot status

When the status of the volume snapshot is Error Deleting,
the status displayed on the snapshot details page is Error_deleting

Change-Id: Ib9541fe0612c154dd3aa4120e3526d678a9f7b37
Closes-Bug: #1816011

Maybe its just me, but I feel like this need to be 8.4 because of the 'Add support to enable ODL deployment on IPv6 networks'? I realize that's probably a lot of work and maybe I'm wrong?"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-02-14 06:45:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Looking at the release notes we have:

 | 8.3.7

 | New Features
 | ************

 | * Add support to enable ODL deployment on IPv6 networks
 |
 | * Added Dell EMC SC multipath support This change adds support for
 |   cinder::backend::dellsc_iscsi::use_multipath_for_image_xfer.
 |
 | * Add new parameter haproxy_log_facility.
 |
 | * Added support for networking-ansible ML2 plugin.


Looking at the changes that add those release notes:

Add support to enable ODL deployment on IPv6 networks - https://review.openstack.org/612238 - Is a bug fix with a scary (from a semver/stable POV) sounding name.


Dell EMC SC: Add use_multipath_for_image_xfer - https://review.openstack.org/616687 - does look a lot like a feature but the functionality is already there in puppet-cinder this just makes it simple to enable.


Allow to set log facility for HAProxy - https://review.openstack.org/635462 - As trivial as it sounds this really is a new feature.

Add manifest for networking_ansible ML2 plugin - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621149/1 - This one is harder to quantify but it doesn't really matter

I get that updating this to 8.4.0 isn't trivial as updating this review and requires extra work in the puppet-tripleo repo but this really is a feature release.

Please update the version to 8.4.0"}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2019-02-14 08:25:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > 
 > | 8.3.7
 > | ^^^^^
 > |
 > |
 > | New Features
 > | ************
 > |
 > | * Add support to enable ODL deployment on IPv6 networks
 > |
 > | * Added Dell EMC SC multipath support This change adds support
 > for
 > |   cinder::backend::dellsc_iscsi::use_multipath_for_image_xfer.
 > |
 > | * Add new parameter haproxy_log_facility.
 > |
 > | * Added support for networking-ansible ML2 plugin.
 > 
 > 
 > Looking at the changes that add those release notes:
 > 
 > Add support to enable ODL deployment on IPv6 networks -
 > https://review.openstack.org/612238 - Is a bug fix with a scary
 > (from a semver/stable POV) sounding name.
 > 
 > 
 > Dell EMC SC: Add use_multipath_for_image_xfer - https://review.openstack.org/616687
 > - does look a lot like a feature but the functionality is already
 > there in puppet-cinder this just makes it simple to enable.
 > 
 > 
 > Allow to set log facility for HAProxy - https://review.openstack.org/635462
 > - As trivial as it sounds this really is a new feature.
 > 
 > Add manifest for networking_ansible ML2 plugin - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621149/1
 > - This one is harder to quantify but it doesn't really matter
 > 
 > I get that updating this to 8.4.0 isn't trivial as updating this
 > review and requires extra work in the puppet-tripleo repo but this
 > really is a feature release.
 > 
 > Please update the version to 8.4.0

Agreed."}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2019-02-14 15:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2019-02-14 15:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from puppet-tripleo-8.3.7 to puppet-tripleo-8.4.0'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-14 15:27:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-02-14 16:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-02-15 14:07:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

The only change since the previous version was the requested version update, so I'm going to go ahead and approve this under the assumption that Tony would be happy with it."}]

messages: [{'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-02-13 19:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2019-02-15 12:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 16:55:32.000000000', 'message': 'Set appropriate default for vxlan multicast ttl

Currently no default is set which means vlxan multicast traffic
is dropped at the first L3 router. This patch increases the default
to 32 which is sufficient for any reasonable network fabric and
can be overridden if necessary.

Without this patch vxlan project networks on a routed underlay network
are not functional

Change-Id: Iddf2e412b3d1f23362d94a7eabd8c062d68ae287
Closes-Bug: 1755790
'}]
commit_message:
Set appropriate default for vxlan multicast ttl

Currently no default is set which means vlxan multicast traffic
is dropped at the first L3 router. This patch increases the default
to 32 which is sufficient for any reasonable network fabric and
can be overridden if necessary.

Without this patch vxlan project networks on a routed underlay network
are not functional

Change-Id: Iddf2e412b3d1f23362d94a7eabd8c062d68ae287
Closes-Bug: 1755790

commit_message:
[SQLite] Ensure change is addressed for limit table

For Sqlite, the "registered_limit" and "limit" tables were dropped
and recreated in 047 migration script[1]. After 047, we should make
sure the change to these two tables has been addressed.

This patch updated 048 expand script to ensure the change
is adopted indeed.

[1]: Ibb408758466ff367f57bafbd4b8c9213499f8dc3

Change-Id: I3989434f661de2c5411b7fad528af1ee4e5ca3fe

commit_message:
Add sqlalchemy collector

Beside the already available collectors, add a sqlalchemy based
collector. This is useful if you don't want to maintain another DB
solution and just use the (usually) already available database.
The driver currently implements the notify() and get_report() methods
so it is possible to store trace points and to get a single trace.

Change-Id: If91b35d4b97862c0ecf6677f4c6b95a09d411195

we don't deploy Docker anymore.

commit_message:
Ignore new ansible-lint pipefail rule

https://github.com/ansible/ansible-lint/pull/199 Introduces a new rule
"shell task uses pipeline without pipefail". This will require refactoring
of several tasks, add ignore to work around CI failures for now.

Change-Id: Ie39e3d1e4e1c8258e2a1db6296686c697b97eb9e

'}, {'created': '2019-02-13 09:38:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix how Mistral prepares data for evaluating a YAQL expression

* If we use the built-in YAQL function 'str' in a workflow then it
  doesn't represent lists as '[item1, item3, ...]' but instead
  creates '(item1, item2,...). This is because the standard YAQL
  function 'yaql_utils.convert_input_data', which is needed to
  convert a initial user data into an internal YAQL format,
  converts all sequences (except strings) into tuples.
  This patch overrides this behavior for sequences that are not
  strings and tuples so that they now get converted into lists.
  YAQL uses tuples because it needs to obtain a safe immutable
  structure to make calculations upon. But in Mistral list is
  more suitable because lots of users care about string
  representations. Immutability is not so important because
  Mistral code base guarantees that the initial data context
  for an expression won't be changed while an expression is
  being evaluated by YAQL.

Change-Id: I69d32f8772418d586d6c414842bb54aada217481
Closes-Bug: #1815710
"}, {'created': '2019-02-14 05:22:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix how Mistral prepares data for evaluating a YAQL expression

* If we use the built-in YAQL function 'str' in a workflow then it
  doesn't represent lists as '[item1, item3, ...]' but instead
  creates '(item1, item2,...). This is because the standard YAQL
  function 'yaql_utils.convert_input_data', which is needed to
  convert a initial user data into an internal YAQL format,
  converts all sequences (except strings) into tuples.
  This patch overrides this behavior for sequences that are not
  strings and tuples so that they now get converted into lists.
  YAQL uses tuples because it needs to obtain a safe immutable
  structure to make calculations upon. But in Mistral list is
  more suitable because lots of users care about string
  representations. Immutability is not so important because
  Mistral code base guarantees that the initial data context
  for an expression won't be changed while an expression is
  being evaluated by YAQL.
* "str" YAQL function used to work well but it was broken in
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/477816/ that added additional
  context preparation in order to fix the issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/mistral/+bug/1772864

Change-Id: I69d32f8772418d586d6c414842bb54aada217481
Closes-Bug: #1815710
'}]
commit_message:
Fix how Mistral prepares data for evaluating a YAQL expression

* If we use the built-in YAQL function 'str' in a workflow then it
  doesn't represent lists as '[item1, item3, ...]' but instead
  creates '(item1, item2,...). This is because the standard YAQL
  function 'yaql_utils.convert_input_data', which is needed to
  convert a initial user data into an internal YAQL format,
  converts all sequences (except strings) into tuples.
  This patch overrides this behavior for sequences that are not
  strings and tuples so that they now get converted into lists.
  YAQL uses tuples because it needs to obtain a safe immutable
  structure to make calculations upon. But in Mistral list is
  more suitable because lots of users care about string
  representations. Immutability is not so important because
  Mistral code base guarantees that the initial data context
  for an expression won't be changed while an expression is
  being evaluated by YAQL.
* "str" YAQL function used to work well but it was broken in
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/477816/ that added additional
  context preparation in order to fix the issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/mistral/+bug/1772864

Change-Id: I69d32f8772418d586d6c414842bb54aada217481
Closes-Bug: #1815710

commit_message:
Use venv_packages_to_symlink to symlink to import libvirt-python

Currently on CentOS7, while deploying nova, it gives libvirt
module import error. By adding venv_packages_to_symlink in
nova_source_install will symlink the packages defined in
nova_compute_kvm_packages_to_symlink and fixes the issue.

It removes nova_compute_kvm_install.yml to use python_venv_build
role.

Change-Id: I20a181c6c4901b3cc846a9f665e5def98aac5059

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 10:12:36.000000000', 'message': "Remove get_config_vhostuser

The 'get_config' in 'nova.virt.libvirt.vif' has two potential code
paths: the os-vif code path or the legacy code path. The former is tried
first, via a call to 'nova_to_osvif_vif' in 'nova.network.ovs_vif_util'.
This in turn looks for a function called '_nova_to_osvif_vif_XYZ', where
'XYZ' is the 'type' field from the VIF object. If this is found then the
relevant os-vif object is generated from nova's VIF objects and this is
used to call another function, '_set_config_XYZ', where 'XYZ' is the
type of the os-vif object. The legacy code path, by comparison, uses the
VIF object directly and simply attempts to call to 'get_config_XYZ' in
'nova.virt.libvirt.vif'. Assuming this is found, it is used to configure
both the VIF object and the libvirt XML.

For VIF types of 'vhostuser', the os-vif code path would attempt to
resolve '_nova_to_osvif_vif_vhostuser' in 'nova.network.os_vif_util'
followed by '_set_config_VIFVHostUser' in the same file. Both exist and
resolution would therefore be successful. However, there is also a
'get_config_vhostuser' function. This is never going to be called and is
probably around for legacy reasons. This means we can remove it in its
entirety and that's exactly what we do.

Here's a mapping of the functions along with their os-vif calls:

  nova.virt.libvirt.vif._get_vhostuser_settings
    -> nova.network.os_vif_util._set_vhostuser_settings
  nova.virt.libvirt.vif.get_config_vhostuser
    -> nova.virt.libvirt.vif._set_config_VIFVHostUser

Change-Id: Ifab3006454708ab290b93f02d82b794c334c3946
"}, {'created': '2018-05-01 15:19:41.000000000', 'message': "Remove get_config_vhostuser

The 'get_config' in 'nova.virt.libvirt.vif' has two potential code
paths: the os-vif code path or the legacy code path. The former is tried
first, via a call to 'nova_to_osvif_vif' in 'nova.network.ovs_vif_util'.
This in turn looks for a function called '_nova_to_osvif_vif_XYZ', where
'XYZ' is the 'type' field from the VIF object. If this is found then the
relevant os-vif object is generated from nova's VIF objects and this is
used to call another function, '_set_config_XYZ', where 'XYZ' is the
type of the os-vif object. The legacy code path, by comparison, uses the
VIF object directly and simply attempts to call to 'get_config_XYZ' in
'nova.virt.libvirt.vif'. Assuming this is found, it is used to configure
both the VIF object and the libvirt XML.

For VIF types of 'vhostuser', the os-vif code path would attempt to
resolve '_nova_to_osvif_vif_vhostuser' in 'nova.network.os_vif_util'
followed by '_set_config_VIFVHostUser' in the same file. While both of
these exist, the former raises a 'NotImplementedError' for generic
vhost-user interfaces so the 'get_config_vhostuser' function, which
duplicates a lot of code. Simplify this by simply handling those generic
vhost-user interfaces, allowing us to resolve this issue.

This also highlights a latent issue, whereby bandwidth limits defined in
the image flavor were not picked up for these generic vhost-user
interfaces.

Here's a mapping of the functions along with their os-vif calls:

  nova.virt.libvirt.vif._get_vhostuser_settings
    -> nova.network.os_vif_util._set_vhostuser_settings
  nova.virt.libvirt.vif.get_config_vhostuser
    -> nova.virt.libvirt.vif._set_config_VIFVHostUser

Change-Id: Ifab3006454708ab290b93f02d82b794c334c3946

commit_message:
Remove get_config_vhostuser

The 'get_config' in 'nova.virt.libvirt.vif' has two potential code
paths: the os-vif code path or the legacy code path. The former is tried
first, via a call to 'nova_to_osvif_vif' in 'nova.network.ovs_vif_util'.
This in turn looks for a function called '_nova_to_osvif_vif_XYZ', where
'XYZ' is the 'type' field from the VIF object. If this is found then the
relevant os-vif object is generated from nova's VIF objects and this is
used to call another function, '_set_config_XYZ', where 'XYZ' is the
type of the os-vif object. The legacy code path, by comparison, uses the
VIF object directly and simply attempts to call to 'get_config_XYZ' in
'nova.virt.libvirt.vif'. Assuming this is found, it is used to configure
both the VIF object and the libvirt XML.

For VIF types of 'vhostuser', the os-vif code path would attempt to
resolve '_nova_to_osvif_vif_vhostuser' in 'nova.network.os_vif_util'
followed by '_set_config_VIFVHostUser' in the same file. While both of
these exist, the former raises a 'NotImplementedError' for generic
vhost-user interfaces so the 'get_config_vhostuser' function is used,
for which we need to keep a lot of duplicated code around. Simplify this
by simply handling those generic vhost-user interfaces, allowing us to
resolve this issue.

Here's a mapping of the functions along with their os-vif calls:

  nova.virt.libvirt.vif._get_vhostuser_settings
    -> nova.network.os_vif_util._set_vhostuser_settings
  nova.virt.libvirt.vif.get_config_vhostuser
    -> nova.virt.libvirt.vif._set_config_VIFVHostUser

Change-Id: Ifab3006454708ab290b93f02d82b794c334c3946

commit_message:
step3: flatten nova service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files
into a single file that performs the docker service installation
and configuration. With this patch the baremetal version of
nova has been removed.

Change-Id: Ic577851f8d865d5eec41dbfb00c27520bedc3fdb

commit_message:
Fix previously broken distro auto-detection

Previous patch made the wrong assumption that
platform.linux_distribution() returns distribution and version but
that is not true.

New logic is using the os-release file which is the official way
to idenfity distribution ID (fedora, centos,..) and its major
version (VERSION_ID). Same logic is used by Ansible.

The final distro result should look like: centos7 or fedora28

If task fails it will silenty default to 'centos7' and raise a clear
warning:

WARNING: Unsupported platform '' detected by tripleo-repos, centos7
will be used unless you use CLI param to change it.

Change-Id: I28690d3576291bca02ea5c4b75689881a8e20a6b
Task: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/733
Follow-Up: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635475/

[{'created': '2019-02-13 16:50:44.000000000', 'message': 'Use math.gcd starting with python 3.5

fractions.gcd is deprecated started in python 3.5 so
this change uses math.gcd if on py3 and fractions.gcd if
on py2.

Change-Id: Ib3dd924e967bc9b48d81dc81e1fcdeba0120985c
'}]
commit_message:
Use math.gcd starting with python 3.5

fractions.gcd is deprecated started in python 3.5 so
this change uses math.gcd if on py3 and fractions.gcd if
on py2.

Change-Id: Ib3dd924e967bc9b48d81dc81e1fcdeba0120985c

commit_message:
Update log level classification info

It is possible monasca-setup configuration process informs user about
errors related to setting up other services, but system is working
correctly. It is expected to change some log level classification for
INFO or WARNING depends on type of message.

Story: 2004970
Task: 29425

Change-Id: Idb8101fea6e7c5c357d72d77b3b264db4cce8527

subject: Fix shell tasks not setting the pipepail option
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 15:30:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix shell tasks not setting the pipepail option

Without the pipefail option set, a shell command that implements a
pipeline can fail ans still return 0. If any part of the pipeline other
than the terminal command fails, the whole pipelin will still return 0,
which may be considered a success by Ansible.

This patch fixes that potential issue.

Change-Id: If2c3c62873798b8d4f75d7be26a5ee02dbc343d6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix shell tasks not setting the pipepail option

Without the pipefail option set, a shell command that implements a
pipeline can fail ans still return 0. If any part of the pipeline other
than the terminal command fails, the whole pipelin will still return 0,
which may be considered a success by Ansible.

This patch fixes that potential issue.

Change-Id: If2c3c62873798b8d4f75d7be26a5ee02dbc343d6

commit_message:
Clean up usage of APIMockTestCase

In Stein development version of horizon, APITestCase and APIMockTestCase
are identical, and APIMockTestCase will be dropped in future.
murano-dashboard is the only consumer of APIMockTestCase now.
This commit clean up the usage of APIMockTestCase.

horizon stein depends on osprofiler>=2.3.0, so lower-constraints.txt
file is updated accordingly.

Change-Id: I36cb8ade8ec80cd313dc9be9e1f1a67daeb60c87

commit_message:
Add missing parts from step2: flatten nova service configuration

[1] missed some parts from puppet/services/nova-libvirt.yaml which
broke tls-everywhere as the qemu-nbd-client-cert were not created,
also the file was not removed after merge.

Changes:
- added missing parts from puppet/services/nova-libvirt.yaml
- removed no longer needed ENV parameters for
  nova_cell_v2_discover_host.py
- re-added /etc/my.cnf.d to nova_cell_v2_discover_host
- deleted puppet/services/nova-libvirt.yaml

[1] https://review.openstack.org/633278

Change-Id: I8d476fd7a040d275cd70ea8393386443b557fe4d
Closes-Bug: #1815888

commit_message:
overcloud/deploy: use overcloud_container_cli to find out which env to load

Some TripleO CI jobs (OVB + HA with Pacemaker) will still need Docker on
the Overcloud until we get CentOS 8.
So this patch will load docker.yaml or podman.yaml depending on what is
overcloud_container_cli.

Depends-On: I80b07c83aae752b2b327a4570bc3df230f6a6319
Change-Id: I15c4c1b7f4c24865759c7225f7212241c9ff63c6

subject: env/docker: add ContainerCli
messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-14 18:46:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-02-14 22:39:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 16:53:20.000000000', 'message': 'env/docker: add ContainerCli

This file will be used until we really get Podman everywhere (so when
CentOS 8 is out).
We still need Docker around for when Pacemaker is used. So this patch
will mainly be used by TripleO CI OVB jobs, so Docker can still be

commit_message:
env/docker: add ContainerCli

This file will be used until we really get Podman everywhere (so when
CentOS 8 is out).
We still need Docker around for when Pacemaker is used. So this patch
will mainly be used by TripleO CI OVB jobs, so Docker can still be
deployed on the Overcloud, and not Podman.

blueprint podman-support

Change-Id: I80b07c83aae752b2b327a4570bc3df230f6a6319

commit_message:
Run hostname check for standalone

Run a hostname preflight check when running the standalone as this can
cause issues with rabbit/mysql/pacemaker/puppet. The standalone check is
not run when an undercloud is being deployed or if output only is
specified. The undercloud has a different set of preflight checks run
prior to deployment so we do not need to rerun the hostname check when
the undercloud is being deployed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634836/
Change-Id: I4de51d792f004575e0e802a1d340478d6ae9f848
Closes-Bug: #1814564

commit_message:
flatten the fluentd service configurations

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration
for the fluentd API service.

Change-Id: If2c2337e715bcdc6747c398406595ea751d79ca7
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

commit_message:
Support update parameters of a resource

This patch implements support to update parameters of an already
existing resource using "crm configure load update FILE"

The parameters of a resource are hashed using md5 and stored in the kv
store, when the checksum doesn't match the resource is updated,
otherwise discarded.

Change-Id: I5735eaa1309c57e3620b0a6f68ffe13ec8165592
Closes-Bug: 1753432

[...]

                connection_info = volume_api.initialize_connection(
                    context, volume_id, connector)
[...]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-09 14:51:22.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Avoid redundant initialize_connection on source post live migration

During live migration we update bdm.connection_info for attached
volumes in pre_live_migration to reflect the new connection on the
destination node. This means that after migration completes we no
longer have a reference to the original connection_info to do the
detach on the source host, so we have to re-fetch it with a second
call to initialize_connection before calling disconnect.

Unfortunately the cinder driver interface does not strictly require
that multiple calls to initialize_connection will return consistent
results, although they normally do in practise. However, there is at
least one cinder driver <insert specifics> which doesn't, and this
results in a failure to disconnect on the source host post migration.

This change avoids the issue entirely by storing the BDMs prior to
modification on the destination node. As well as working round this
specific issue, it also avoids a redundant cinder call in all cases.

Change-Id: I0390c9ff51f49b063f736ca6ef868a4fa782ede5
Resolves: a bug I haven't filed yet
"}, {'created': '2018-03-09 14:58:04.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Avoid redundant initialize_connection on source post live migration

"}, {'created': '2018-03-09 17:43:34.000000000', 'message': "Avoid redundant initialize_connection on source post live migration

During live migration we update bdm.connection_info for attached volumes
in pre_live_migration to reflect the new connection on the destination
node. This means that after migration completes the BDM no longer has a
reference to the original connection_info to do the detach on the source
host. To address this, change I3dfb75eb added a second call to
initialize_connection on the source host to re-fetch the original
connection_info before calling disconnect.

Unfortunately the cinder driver interface does not strictly require that
multiple calls to initialize_connection will return consistent results.
Although they normally do in practice, there is at least one cinder
driver (delliscsi) which doesn't. This results in a failure to
disconnect on the source host post migration.

This change avoids the issue entirely by fetching the BDMs prior to
modification on the destination node. As well as working round this
specific issue, it also avoids a redundant cinder call in all cases.

Fixes: bug #1754716
Change-Id: I0390c9ff51f49b063f736ca6ef868a4fa782ede5
"}, {'created': '2018-03-09 17:47:00.000000000', 'message': "Avoid redundant initialize_connection on source post live migration

During live migration we update bdm.connection_info for attached volumes
in pre_live_migration to reflect the new connection on the destination
node. This means that after migration completes the BDM no longer has a
reference to the original connection_info to do the detach on the source
host. To address this, change I3dfb75eb added a second call to

Fixes: bug #1754716
Change-Id: I0390c9ff51f49b063f736ca6ef868a4fa782ede5
"}, {'created': '2018-03-13 13:54:14.000000000', 'message': "Avoid redundant initialize_connection on source post live migration

During live migration we update bdm.connection_info for attached volumes
in pre_live_migration to reflect the new connection on the destination
node. This means that after migration completes the BDM no longer has a
reference to the original connection_info to do the detach on the source
host. To address this, change I3dfb75eb added a second call to
initialize_connection on the source host to re-fetch the original
connection_info before calling disconnect.

Unfortunately the cinder driver interface does not strictly require that
multiple calls to initialize_connection will return consistent results.
Although they normally do in practice, there is at least one cinder
driver (delliscsi) which doesn't. This results in a failure to
disconnect on the source host post migration.

This change avoids the issue entirely by fetching the BDMs prior to
modification on the destination node. As well as working round this
specific issue, it also avoids a redundant cinder call in all cases.

Note that this massively simplifies post_live_migration in the libvirt
driver. The complexity removed was concerned with reconstructing the
original connection_info. This required considering the cinder v2 and v3
use cases, and reconstructing the multipath_id which was written to
connection_info by the libvirt fibrechannel volume connector on
connection. These things are not necessary when we just use the original
data unmodified.

Other drivers affected are Xenapi and HyperV. Xenapi doesn't touch
volumes in post_live_migration, so is unaffected. HyperV did not
previously account for differences in connection_info between source and
destination, so was likely previously broken. This change should fix it.

Fixes: bug #1754716
Change-Id: I0390c9ff51f49b063f736ca6ef868a4fa782ede5

previously account for differences in connection_info between source and
destination, so was likely previously broken. This change should fix it.

"}, {'created': '2018-07-10 13:24:25.000000000', 'message': "Avoid redundant initialize_connection on source post live migration

During live migration we update bdm.connection_info for attached volumes
in pre_live_migration to reflect the new connection on the destination
node. This means that after migration completes the BDM no longer has a
reference to the original connection_info to do the detach on the source
host. To address this, change I3dfb75eb added a second call to
initialize_connection on the source host to re-fetch the source host
connection_info before calling disconnect.

Unfortunately the cinder driver interface does not strictly require that
multiple calls to initialize_connection will return consistent results.
Although they normally do in practice, there is at least one cinder
driver (delliscsi) which doesn't. This results in a failure to
disconnect on the source host post migration.

This change avoids the issue entirely by fetching the BDMs prior to
modification on the destination node. As well as working round this
specific issue, it also avoids a redundant cinder call in all cases.

Note that this massively simplifies post_live_migration in the libvirt
driver. The complexity removed was concerned with reconstructing the
original connection_info. This required considering the cinder v2 and v3
use cases, and reconstructing the multipath_id which was written to
connection_info by the libvirt fibrechannel volume connector on
connection. These things are not necessary when we just use the original
data unmodified.

Other drivers affected are Xenapi and HyperV. Xenapi doesn't touch
volumes in post_live_migration, so is unaffected. HyperV did not
previously account for differences in connection_info between source and
destination, so was likely previously broken. This change should fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1754716
Change-Id: I0390c9ff51f49b063f736ca6ef868a4fa782ede5

commit_message:
Avoid redundant initialize_connection on source post live migration

During live migration we update bdm.connection_info for attached volumes
in pre_live_migration to reflect the new connection on the destination
node. This means that after migration completes the BDM no longer has a
reference to the original connection_info to do the detach on the source
host. To address this, change I3dfb75eb added a second call to
initialize_connection on the source host to re-fetch the source host
connection_info before calling disconnect.

Unfortunately the cinder driver interface does not strictly require that
multiple calls to initialize_connection will return consistent results.
Although they normally do in practice, there is at least one cinder
driver (delliscsi) which doesn't. This results in a failure to
disconnect on the source host post migration.

This change avoids the issue entirely by fetching the BDMs prior to
modification on the destination node. As well as working round this
specific issue, it also avoids a redundant cinder call in all cases.

Note that this massively simplifies post_live_migration in the libvirt
driver. The complexity removed was concerned with reconstructing the
original connection_info. This required considering the cinder v2 and v3
use cases, and reconstructing the multipath_id which was written to
connection_info by the libvirt fibrechannel volume connector on
connection. These things are not necessary when we just use the original
data unmodified.

Other drivers affected are Xenapi and HyperV. Xenapi doesn't touch
volumes in post_live_migration, so is unaffected. HyperV did not
previously account for differences in connection_info between source and
destination, so was likely previously broken. This change should fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1754716
Closes-Bug: #1814245
Change-Id: I0390c9ff51f49b063f736ca6ef868a4fa782ede5

subject: Support benchmark openstack by scripts include: - script context: script setup environment before run benchmark and cleanup environment after that - script scenario: run benchmark tools and run script to collect results
messages:
[{'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2018-09-11 04:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2018-09-11 10:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2018-09-12 17:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Lgtm, could you share real examples for using this?'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2018-09-13 03:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This plugin uses for benchmark openstack by third-party tools.

Example for script scenario: benchmark mysql by sysbench tool
http://paste.openstack.org/show/730000/
"sh collect_results.sh" can replaced by any command calling such as python, java, c-compiled app, ...
"sh collect_results.sh" => read result files from tool and generate chart data and transform to json format:
{
    "data": [
        {
            "additive": { },
            "complete": { }
        }
    ]
}
Example for chart data:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/730001/
The plugin 'll auto load chart data and generate charts.

Summary, this plugins provide quick shortcut to run benchmark openstack by independency tools as sysbench (test mysql), ab (test load balancer), oslo-messaging or rabbitmq-perf-test (test rabbitmq),...
User only need to write script "collect_results" by any languages to transform result to chart data.'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2018-09-13 03:39:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This is rally report with sysbench tool:
https://prnt.sc/ktsmux'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-09-13 10:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Dat!

It looks like your plugins do not relate to OpenStack at all and look more generic. Please propose this patch to openstack/rally main repo'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2018-09-13 11:43:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Andrey Kurilin,
Rally is framework so, maybe should not propose this plugin to it. Rally-openstack currently provides benchmark plugins of openstack while control plane performance such as database, message queue is not yet supported. In other hand, there are very many third-party tools that supported to analyze those performance. However, those tools generate results by different ways and has no united chart report as rally-openstack.
So, It's wonderful if combine two characteristics.
Thanks for watching!"}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-09-21 15:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

hi Dat! Sorry for long reply.

> Rally is framework so, maybe should not propose this plugin to it. 

yes and not :) rally repo contains framework part and common plugins. see https://github.com/openstack/rally/tree/master/rally/plugins/common

> Rally-openstack currently provides benchmark plugins of openstack while control plane performance such as database, message queue is not yet supported. 

The issue that your plugins can be used not only for OpenStack. For example, there are rally plugins for kubernetes platform (https://github.com/xrally/xrally-kubernetes) and your plugin can be helpful for k8s as well. It looks like a huge issue to download all dependencies (https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/requirements.txt) which are required for openstack platform to use just one your plugins to check k8s platform. That is why it would be nice to place your plugins in a common place where everyone will able to use them.'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2018-09-24 05:30:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok, I 'll propose this plugin to common plugin of rally project in next time. Thanks for all!"}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2019-02-15 07:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

propose to rally project'}]

commit_message:
Support benchmark openstack by scripts include:
- script context: script setup environment before run benchmark and cleanup environment after that
- script scenario: run benchmark tools and run script to collect results

Change-Id: Ib42ddb5336d3e8de14a950baeeaa15c03ba608af

commit_message:
Change nova-next tempest test regex

Before this change, nova-next ran the same tests
as the tempest-full job which was all non-slow API
and scenario tests.

To avoid running redundant tests on the same nova
change, this patch changes the tempest run regex
to run only compute API tests along with all
scenario tests and includes slow tests (by not
excluding them like tempest-full does).

By removing the non-compute API tests we should
still be able to keep this job running in a reasonable
time even though the slow tests are added.

As discussed in https://review.openstack.org/606978/,
test_volume_swap_with_multiattach will be run again
with this change since it otherwise won't run in
tempest-slow since that is a multi-node job and the
test was blocked from running in multi-node jobs until
bug 1807723 is fixed. In other words, this gives us
volume multi-attach testing of swap volumes again since
nova-next is a single-node job.

Change-Id: Icbc06849dfcc9f41c7aaf7de109e036a993de7c7

Good stuff Jim.

In a change like this, there is the potential for compatibility breakage. For example, if the cinder thing had actually been using its capture groups, a potentially-dirty value (e.g. with non-\w chars at the beginning or end) could have been accepted and still worked. revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 13:18:26.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure config regexes match the entire string

Oslo.config uses re.search() to check config values against the allowed
regex. This checks if the regex matches anywhere in the string, rather
than checking if the entire string matches the regex.

Make sure config options where the entire string should match the given
regex actually do so.

Change-Id: I9e30a24a4c0640f282f507d0a96640d3cdefe43c
Closes-Bug: #1815763
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure config regexes match the entire string

Oslo.config uses re.search() to check config values against the allowed
regex. This checks if the regex matches anywhere in the string, rather
than checking if the entire string matches the regex.

Make sure config options where the entire string should match the given
regex actually do so.

Change-Id: I9e30a24a4c0640f282f507d0a96640d3cdefe43c
Closes-Bug: #1815763

commit_message:
Parameter changed from mgmt_url to mgmt_ip_address

At present the VNF mgmt ip is assigned to parameter "mgmt_url",
it is changed to mgmt_ip_address which will be relevant one

Change-Id: Ic372dd8bf317e1d571bf9e189670768b4d17d7ae
Closes-Bug: #1648327

subject: Fix up flakey TestContainer.test_PUT_bad_metadata
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-02-14 21:02:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-02-14 21:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Seen in the gate: http://logs.openstack.org/84/636684/2/check/swift-tox-func-encryption/b84cf19/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-02-13_20_41_08_306786'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-02-14 21:42:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't quite understand why this sort of relaxation is okay. Are we racing something? Maybe fixing that is a better answer?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-02-14 21:52:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The trouble's in the retry (I'm pretty sure). I issue a request, the proxy times out talking to most (but not all) backend servers, so it responds 503 even though somebody (maybe even a *majority* of servers) was able to process it. Client sees the 503, says, "Ah! I ought to try again" and does -- but this time the work is already done, so it gets back a different response code.

I guess the question is, what are these tests trying to verify? Seems to be things along the lines of "we can successfully PUT with a metadata key that's max_meta_name_length long" -- so what should we consider "success"? Seems to me that either 201 or 202 meets that fairly well.

Even better would be for us to do a GET and verify that the metadata is there, though...'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-02-14 23:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I see, thanks.'}]

Change-Id: I7489f2bb95c27d1ddd5e8fa7e5786904100fb567
'}]

commit_message:
Make get_data/async/tmp_dir explicit

functools.partial is all well and good in code, but apparently it
doesn't play real well with docs.

commit_message:
Update region policies to use system admin

This change updates the policies for the regions API to include
system administrators and includes appropriate test coverage. A
subsequent set of patches will introduce test coverage for:

 - domains user test coverage
 - project users test coverage

 Related-Bug: 1804292
 Closes-Bug: 1804446

Change-Id: I84dd7fc69a2eab9ab8c2130f26a2fb664d5663a5

[{'created': '2019-02-14 15:52:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bindep for SUSE

In bindep, rpm usually implies both RedHat and SUSE family distros, but
in some cases the package names are slightly different. This patch
corrects the package names that were different between distros. This
will help developers who use SUSE as their development platform of
choice.

Change-Id: If07b3d3291cf3e1bf35eec1e3dd91a13ab65b0ea
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bindep for SUSE

In bindep, rpm usually implies both RedHat and SUSE family distros, but
in some cases the package names are slightly different. This patch
corrects the package names that were different between distros. This
will help developers who use SUSE as their development platform of
choice.

Change-Id: If07b3d3291cf3e1bf35eec1e3dd91a13ab65b0ea

commit_message:
Increment nginx check port

In the event that both NGINX and apache are co-existing on the same machine
the status port check for both platforms will be the same, and that will
cause one of the services to not start. This change increments the NGINX
check port to ensure there are no conflicts.

Change-Id: I03d5d351fff2d6926f35ca860c01f5a075de42aa
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Microversion 2.68: Remove 'forced' live migrations, evacuations

Update the commands and Python API bindings to reflect the new
microversion. The various evacuate microversion functions are DRY'd up
along the way.

Change-Id: Ibfc905292258ffde05800387e5d6bbad4823085c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634600/
Implements: blueprint remove-force-flag-from-live-migrate-and-evacuate

commit_message:
Fix repo configuration

The wrong parameter name was used for the repo configuration.
It should have been rpm_setup_config not rpm_setup. Additionally the
iptables rules did not allow for the containers to fetch the repos from
the CI host. This change lets docker manage the docker iptables rules
and adds a rule to allow port 80 from the docker container ip range.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634064/
Change-Id: I037465f7bbc7b6016373385f07c7c944a09299c9
Closes-Bug: #1813527

commit_message:
Add gdisk to overcloud image

Operators found it useful to use gdisk to clear disks for ceph rather
than the cleaning in ironic in some cases. This change adds it back to
the overcloud images.

Change-Id: Ia44e21055b45e1d48e428efeb0adaafbfcf058c7
Closes-Bug: #1815787

shouldn't this depend on the used container cli options?"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-02-13 13:32:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

We'll remove Docker in this cycle anyway and switch container_cli to "podman" by default (and even remove ContainerCli if we have time, it was used as an internal parameter anyway). I'm fine with this patch.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-02-13 14:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-14 18:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Use the new services names for sfc

Since Rocky, sfc and flow_classifier can be used instead of

-networking_sfc.services.sfc.plugin.SfcPlugin
-networking_sfc.services.sfc.plugin.FlowClassifierPlugin

which looks better

Change-Id: Ie94db64abf6cba1ba76c3c3e9b614b8b0be38d0b
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-28 23:11:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix deps for api-samples tox env

The api-samples tox target fails since it can't
find placement. This fixes it by using the same
deps trick as the other functional test environments.

Change-Id: I815b8b3cff5dcbb0fc4be5f1d85019111c2009e5
"}, {'created': '2019-02-11 14:28:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix deps for api-samples tox env

The api-samples tox target fails since it can't
find placement. This fixes it by using the same
deps trick as the other functional test environments.

Change-Id: I815b8b3cff5dcbb0fc4be5f1d85019111c2009e5
"}, {'created': '2019-02-14 15:52:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deps for api-samples tox env

The api-samples tox target fails since it needs the
PlacementFixture which comes from the placement repo.
This fixes it by using the same deps trick as the other
functional test environments.

As a result, the shared environment is also removed.

Change-Id: I815b8b3cff5dcbb0fc4be5f1d85019111c2009e5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deps for api-samples tox env

The api-samples tox target fails since it needs the
PlacementFixture which comes from the placement repo.
This fixes it by using the same deps trick as the other
functional test environments.

As a result, the shared environment is also removed.

Change-Id: I815b8b3cff5dcbb0fc4be5f1d85019111c2009e5

commit_message:
Default zero disk flavor to RULE_ADMIN_API in Stein

The policy to allow booting instances without a volume when
root_gb is set to 0 was to be set to default to admin-only
in Stein.

Depends-On: I537c299b0cd400982189f35b31df74755422737e

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Related-Bug: #1739646
Change-Id: I247402b6c4ff8a7cb71ef247a218478194d68ff8

Fix a missing policy in test policy data

Add the 'os_compute_api:os-flavor-manage:update'
in the test policy data in nova/tests/unit/fake_policy.py.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Fix dashboards and possible port conflicts

This change ensures we are not creating a port conflict for apache/nginx when
status is enabled. This change also ensures dashboards are created correctly
resolving an issue with index-patterns containing a regex.

Change-Id: I8228fc9832d02518d2db843c96abf6dffc63bdfc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Add network_data requirements to multi-overcloud

Specify in multi-overcloud deployment process that a network-data.yaml
with unique name_lower values is required.

Change-Id: I035374bb215dc469260b4855ef04e14016465e31

commit_message:
Disable ansible callback plugin for image prepare

ara has issues when enabled when we run the container image prepare
because of concurrency problems.

Depends-On: I651c082587fbcc070b107b686e364755eb028354
Change-Id: I04263ecd26249e4ab3188f1a835a4af700500855
Related-Bug: #1796764

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 19:56:18.000000000', 'message': 'Bump timeout on dsvm jobs

Many time out even when all tests are succeeding and
we will save more resources not having to recheck than by
keeping the timeout where it is.

(cherry picked from commit 1471376131859fcafeb3e88c2058549c5fc24fad)

commit_message:
Bump timeout on dsvm jobs

Many time out even when all tests are succeeding and
we will save more resources not having to recheck than by
keeping the timeout where it is.

Change-Id: I2a84e7a1340ccccb79170196b810aeda7d12914d
(cherry picked from commit 1471376131859fcafeb3e88c2058549c5fc24fad)
(cherry picked from commit 94ee6dfde8b4e224d75bb667d4f8a2e93a05d3f9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 07:37:52.000000000', 'message': 'Trivial: return empty set instead of list

_provider_ids_matching_aggregates returned a) a set of resource
provider ids or b) an empty list if no resource provider found.

This patch tweaks it to return an empty *set* instead of list
for the consistency.

Change-Id: Id463f0955231f1dfa3a363a738f9428078189a4a
'}]
commit_message:
Trivial: return empty set instead of list

_provider_ids_matching_aggregates returned a) a set of resource
provider ids or b) an empty list if no resource provider found.

This patch tweaks it to return an empty *set* instead of list
for the consistency.

commit_message:
Update Puppetforge secret

The earlier copy of the secret was encrypted with a trailing
newline. Do it again but pass --strip on the command line.

Change-Id: Ibd6ec4b47d3d451fab1a27d6753e843a3f2e0f11

commit_message:
Remove cinder v1 from service catalog

Change I03bf2db5bd7e2fdfb4f6032758ccaf2b348a82ba removed the Block
Storage API v1 over a year ago.  It should no longer be included as
an endpoint in the devstack service catalog.

commit_message:
Explicitly use venv-py2 to run sahara-scenario

This patch is required only on the stable branches, because
master will end up using Python 3 to execute sahara-scenario.
It ensures that sahara-scenario will always be executed using
Python 2 on this branch.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/608211
Change-Id: I3b0a4c0c26f96a901c8df215a8abc8bd73278c12

[{'created': '2018-10-31 08:57:54.000000000', 'message': 'Increase inotify watch limit

If the inotify watch limit is exceeded then systemd is unable to
restart services. This can occur during an OSA minor upgrade, and results
in dnsmasq unable to restart on all container hosts simultaneously.

Change-Id: I77da5d99f0714975c1be025b46bb250712c78ed3
'}]
commit_message:
Increase inotify watch limit

If the inotify watch limit is exceeded then systemd is unable to
restart services. This can occur during an OSA minor upgrade, and results
in dnsmasq unable to restart on all container hosts simultaneously.

Change-Id: I77da5d99f0714975c1be025b46bb250712c78ed3

commit_message:
Add manila-ui integration tests

This patch adds basic tests to verify that manila-ui is
installed and could be opened.

manila-ui-integration-tests job is added in a
non-voting mode.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/634712
Change-Id: I67e876a5cb26637b62225fc854a906dc1a714e76

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 16137, 'name': 'Tobias Urdin', 'email': 'tobias.urdin@binero.com', 'username': 'tobasco'}, {'_account_id': 17216, 'name': 'Martin Schuppert', 'email': 'mschuppert@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcschupp'}, {'_account_id': 21129, 'name': 'Alan Bishop', 'email': 'abishop@redhat.com', 'username': 'ASBishop'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-02-12 22:30:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-02-13 00:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-02-13 08:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-13 11:50:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-02-13 13:16:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-13 14:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

How about deprecate the user/role ones that is for v2/v3, do a pick for the values and output a warning if the v2/v3 ones is used? (configure_user_v3 etc) that way there will be only one parameter for configure user/roles and not 4 or 6.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-02-13 15:14:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It makes sense to deprecate the _v2|3 user and user role parameters if they truly are extraneous. I don't know if anyone uses them, but assumed they were added because ~someone~ needed them.

I also prefer not mingling those changes into this patch, which is focused on removing the v1 stuff from the keystone catalog. Could we continue the cleanup work in subsequent patches?

While on the scope of changes in this patch, do you think it suitable for backporting to stable/rocky and stable/queens? Clearly we don't typically backport deprecations, but in this case Cinder's API v1 was completely removed in Queens!"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-13 19:04:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-02-13 19:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-13 19:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-02-13 22:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-13 23:28:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-02-14 07:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-14 09:07:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Do we want to remove the service and endpoint of v1 for deployments? Maybe it doesn't really matter but if we want to we need to separate to two different service_identity resources, one which ensures user/role is present and another which ensures service/endpoint for v1 is absent."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-02-14 13:36:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The earlier patchsets removed the keystone endpoint and service, but Alex pointed out that might be too opinionated, and it should be up to the admin to decide whether to delete them. The latest patchset doesn't delete anything, which I mention in the release note."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-14 14:41:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-14 15:00:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-02-14 17:16:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck
tempest failure looks unrelated.'}]

Existing keystone catalog entries for v1 are not removed. It is the

Change-Id: I4a317d0eb2a2359c484b70eec97e8411dc22e9e8
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create keystone service or endpoint for API v1

Cinder removed support for API v1 in Queens [1], so don't create the
keystone service or endpoint for v1.

Existing keystone catalog entries for v1 are not removed. It is the
user's responsibility for removing them.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/499342

Change-Id: I4a317d0eb2a2359c484b70eec97e8411dc22e9e8

commit_message:
Make security group API reads and deletes faster.

1. Previous reviews for reducing the amount of data had a high
impact on the OVO implementation, but only the SG's have this child
data performance problem. Let's try a lower impact method for
providing both a shallow and deep OVO SG object, via two objects.
2. Use shallow object where possible.

Change-Id: Idd638740967ff8edd44e476fe0a0bcf6f23cfd22

commit_message:
add tripleo scenario004 to experimental queue

A recent change [1] in master added a tripleo scenario004
job to the experimental queue so we can run it before merging
changes that might affect downstream tripleo CI.  We can't
cherry-pick that change because that scenario isn't supported
on single node CI in stable/rocky.

Here we add a multinode version of that scenario.

Change-Id: I2743ce3c472d940c23baf3955e09a81427e381e1

commit_message:
Enable functional deployment of FWaaS v2

This patch updates various vars and templates to enable a functioning
deployment of FWaaS v2 on an Open vSwitch-based OSA cloud. A test is
also included for verification.

Change-Id: Ibfa2cbafd19f6870139c4ea3e9dfc80cf8c574e1
Closes-Bug: #1811070

commit_message:
Use venv-py2 to run sahara-scenario, remove the py3 job

This patch is required only on the stable branches, because
master will end up using Python 3 to execute sahara-scenario.
It ensures that sahara-scenario will always be executed using
Python 2 on this branch.

Also remove the Python 3 experimental job: it is not working
and it will be fixed only in master/future Stein. So save
a bit of resources.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/608211
Change-Id: I41a26d3a7ca47c40b9fac815552d5a601f131bae

messages: [{'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-02-14 18:51:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-02-14 19:42:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11580, 'date': '2019-02-14 19:48:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nGood to go!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 18:51:01.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor out Ceilometer V2 API related code

As of Queens the Ceilometer V2 API has been removed.  Storage
driver related code in monasca-ceilometer can thus be removed.

Backport some refactoring that came up in creating
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562400/
Realized some class names could be clearer and fit better with
Ceilometer.

Update test-requirements.txt with Rocky release of
python-monascaclient.  Also include more license info.

Specify py35 instead of py34 in tox.ini (gates already using py35).

Include updates to devstack configuration to keep up with master
ceilometer.  These include adding values for the [monasca] section
in ceilometer.conf and refreshing setup.cfg as well as updating
how the connection url to Monasca API is configured.

Also include some testing notes in devstack/README.md

(cherry picked from commit 8b0fb6d0485d1e446a2a4672286c8254e2a9aef9)

Change-Id: I4a407e0a5e2ef1518bfe76f5f583d6572d428b2f
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor out Ceilometer V2 API related code

As of Queens the Ceilometer V2 API has been removed.  Storage
driver related code in monasca-ceilometer can thus be removed.

Backport some refactoring that came up in creating
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562400/
Realized some class names could be clearer and fit better with
Ceilometer.

Update test-requirements.txt with Rocky release of
python-monascaclient.  Also include more license info.

Specify py35 instead of py34 in tox.ini (gates already using py35).

Include updates to devstack configuration to keep up with master
ceilometer.  These include adding values for the [monasca] section
in ceilometer.conf and refreshing setup.cfg as well as updating
how the connection url to Monasca API is configured.

Also include some testing notes in devstack/README.md

(cherry picked from commit 8b0fb6d0485d1e446a2a4672286c8254e2a9aef9)

Change-Id: I4a407e0a5e2ef1518bfe76f5f583d6572d428b2f

commit_message:
[CI] Fix logs for the functional test job

- Use roles from the openstack-infra/zuul-jobs
  repository to gather appropriate files after
  each job run.
- Gather the etc/ folder to gather test
  configuration.

Change-Id: I07676362e3b83cf2e50e177c1f37d926bb86c4ac
(cherry picked from commit dfd18798eb0e5bc152bc2761ebe323b2a8bca405)
(cherry picked from commit 52760a69e2831e80ebf55b24c1f00f078207b341)

flatten sensu service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files
into a single file that performs the docker service installation
and configuration.

initiating the guest transfer in the hypervisor. There are
