commit_message:
Change live_migration_wait_for_vif_plug=True by default

This resolves the TODO to make the option default to True
so that the source compute service will wait for the
"network-vif-plugged" event, initiated by vif plugging during
pre_live_migration on the destination compute servie, before
initiating the guest transfer in the hypervisor. There are
certain networking backends that will not send the neutron
event for vif plugging alone (which is arguably a bug) but
OVS and linuxbridge, probably the two most widely used in
OpenStack deployments, are known to work with this config.

While in here, the Timeout message is fleshed out to give
more help with what the cause of the timeout could be and
possible recourse.

Change-Id: I8da38aec0fe4808273b8587ace3df9dbbc3ab576

subject: Updated policy names
messages:
[{'account_id': 26733, 'date': '2018-10-27 06:32:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-11-13 00:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Seems simple enough. Are there any other components that this would effect beside the change in monasca-events-api?'}, {'account_id': 26733, 'date': '2018-11-16 16:20:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Seems simple enough. Are there any other components that this would
 > effect beside the change in monasca-events-api?

Yes, I will fix them after merging this.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-02-13 15:58:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm ok with this as long as it won't break other things in the time it takes to change the other components."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-02-13 17:43:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-02-13 21:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26733, 'date': '2019-02-14 08:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-02-14 13:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26733, 'date': '2019-02-14 14:32:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)

1. I think based on Naming Policies [https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#naming-policies] 'admin_required' is not correct. (it is a policy name) and also I saw in Nova they are using 'admin_api' that's the reason I changed it to 'admin_api'
2. All other monasca projects which are using policy should be updated, all of the policy names they are using and also this one which they are using from monasca-common. it means it should be changed into 'admin_api' in monasca-api, monasca-events, ...etc
3. My plan is to update monasca-common at first then make a new release, update the other projects and force them to use the new release of monasca-common."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-02-14 19:16:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The document speaks about policy names and you're changing here the rule name. `admin_required` is a reasonable name and is used for example in Keystone as well.
I don't care that much about this particular name but changing it causes a chain of other changes in monasca-events-api as you can see in your other change."}, {'account_id': 26733, 'date': '2019-02-14 19:20:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> The document speaks about policy names and you're changing here the
 > rule name. `admin_required` is a reasonable name and is used for
 > example in Keystone as well.
 > I don't care that much about this particular name but changing it
 > causes a chain of other changes in monasca-events-api as you can
 > see in your other change.

I agree, then lets abandon 

 > The document speaks about policy names and you're changing here the
 > rule name. `admin_required` is a reasonable name and is used for
 > example in Keystone as well.
 > I don't care that much about this particular name but changing it
 > causes a chain of other changes in monasca-events-api as you can
 > see in your other change.
I agree. then let's abandon this patch."}, {'account_id': 26733, 'date': '2019-02-14 19:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}]

commit_message:
Change the q_mem and h_mem to lower and upper limits

This change removes the {h,q}_mem options in favor of a new variable which
clearly states the upper and lower limits for a given deployment. This change
also makes these options a lot more conservative by default which will allow
the deployment to better run on shared infra.

Change-Id: I169f457198c11edc4881a04df65312f6c4f67feb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Make use of standalone-tripleo.yml env in standalone-upgrade.

The standalone deployment role is using /environments/standalone/
standalone-tripleo.yaml file, however in the role used for upgrading
we append environment/standalone.yml instead of the very same one.
This is causing issues at the time of upgrading.

Change-Id: I5ab70931d5df74a1e4f3369886f3b5ace9e11222
Closes-Bug: #1815770

commit_message:
Make fip topology check configurable

Horizon will by default check that a project has
a router with a port on an external network prior
to allowing floating ips to be attached to
instances. Since it is valid to use a shared
router from a different project we make this
configurable to allow disabling this check.

Closes-Bug: #1815032
Change-Id: I5c3e44e5daa683e14ac39979d6e9a7c2238dd120
(cherry picked from commit ac7793ffee62c5356980bc0011c43939f0e755e0)

commit_message:
Fix PostgreSQL non-dynamic configration tests

The parameter 'log_min_duration_statement' was updated to support unit
suffixes like 'ms' in [1], but reverted in [2] by accident.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/370982/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537665/

Change-Id: I6fa6785bc8438ccc28a815abd1a99526ff03b87c
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9d159fd0e7c15a10ba5155a05c79015591229619)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-17 19:53:30.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore user/domain not found on initial validate

This changes the behavior of validating the user id/name
and domain id/name given by not immediately responding
with an unauthorized response if the user/domain does
not exist. This helps reduce the ability to determine
existing users/domains via response time by continuing
on and responding accordingly later if a user/domain
is not found.

This may cause some potential performance degredation
for actions querying non-existing users/domains. Normal
operations should see no change.

Change-Id: I278e313642236a5fbeb362dce643ee6cd467f306
Closes-Bug: #1795800
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore user/domain not found on initial validate

This changes the behavior of validating the user id/name
and domain id/name given by not immediately responding
with an unauthorized response if the user/domain does
not exist. This helps reduce the ability to determine
existing users/domains via response time by continuing
on and responding accordingly later if a user/domain
is not found.

This may cause some potential performance degredation
for actions querying non-existing users/domains. Normal
operations should see no change.

Change-Id: I278e313642236a5fbeb362dce643ee6cd467f306
Closes-Bug: #1795800

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-06 14:41:02.000000000', 'message': 'Set bandwidth limits for generic vHost User interfaces

This is done for OVS vHost User interfaces but not for other types, such
as those used by OpenContrail. This is a mistake. Correct it.

Change-Id: Id57e4c149616fe0896e80fca322ece79ec3bfd69
Closes-Bug: #1814882
'}, {'created': '2019-02-12 16:58:06.000000000', 'message': "Don't set bandwidth limits for vhostuser, hostdev interfaces

'tc' [1] is used for rate limiting in libvirt. This is suitable for tap
devices but not for the sockets used by vhostuser interface or for
physical devices; rate limiting for these interfaces must be done in the
vSwitch or via the interface itself. For this reason, libvirt explicitly
marks these interfaces, along with some other interfaces types, as not
supporting bandwidth limiting [2]. Given that there is no reason to be
setting the bandwidth-related attributes on vhostuser or hostdev
interfaces, we should stop doing it.

[1] http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man8/tc.8.html
[2] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/blob/568a41722/src/conf/netdev_bandwidth_conf.h#L38

Change-Id: Id57e4c149616fe0896e80fca322ece79ec3bfd69
Closes-Bug: #1814882
"}]
commit_message:
Don't set bandwidth limits for vhostuser, hostdev interfaces

'tc' [1] is used for rate limiting in libvirt. This is suitable for tap
devices but not for the sockets used by vhostuser interface or for
physical devices; rate limiting for these interfaces must be done in the
vSwitch or via the interface itself. For this reason, libvirt explicitly
marks these interfaces, along with some other interfaces types, as not
supporting bandwidth limiting [2]. Given that there is no reason to be
setting the bandwidth-related attributes on vhostuser or hostdev
interfaces, we should stop doing it.

[1] http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man8/tc.8.html
[2] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/blob/568a41722/src/conf/netdev_bandwidth_conf.h#L38

Change-Id: Id57e4c149616fe0896e80fca322ece79ec3bfd69
Closes-Bug: #1814882

messages:
[{'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-15 18:04:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-10-15 18:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

There are material changes between python3.5 and 3.6/3.7 in how the code itself works. I expect we will need to maintain python3.5 testing for the forseeable future, especially if we drop py2.7 testing in the near-ish term.

-2 on these changes. Chattted with zaneb in #openstack-tc and it appeears the plan is to keep py35.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-15 19:46:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

[{'created': '2018-10-15 18:04:04.000000000', 'message': "Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I67aea3f93e54c55952f33464e582cc989c9867ea

under Python 3.7.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

commit_message:
doc: specify --os-compute-api-version when setting flavor description

This is a follow up to change I0f206d9db70465d8ce6b1404f546f3e00eeb6e23
where we changed the docs from using "nova flavor-update" to
"openstack flavor set --description" but unlike nova CLI which
negotiates the highest available microversion by default, OSC does not
and defaults to 2.1 which won't work when trying to set a flavor
description. This change adds the --os-compute-api-version option
to the command line example to make that command work.

Change-Id: I7eacc30b4cf3a5ef89f90ec599f21eaa12bf2a10

commit_message:
Switch Tacker service to cycle-with-rc

There were several deliverables set as cycle-with-intermediary that have
not been doing intermediary releases. That release model is intended for
deliverables that will be releases multiple times throughout the
development cycle.

With the newer cycle-with-rc release model, teams have the option of not
requiring releases during the cycle and just making sure they are done
near the end of the cycle. See [1] for more details.

This proposes to change the cycle-with-intermediary deliverable to be
cycle-with-rc. Please confirm this is acceptable for the team and feel
free to ask any questions about this change.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000465.html

Change-Id: Id7477108ad20ef5187bc9da867455239d2fc240a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix functional tests

Manila's ci scripts disable configuring the
default share and share group types if testing
with the dummy driver.

We want to continue using the the default types
mechanism in python-manilaclient, until we decide
not to.

Change-Id: I14544bea728286eeb33461e724d991fe556a4269
Closes-Bug: #1787292
(cherry picked from commit e7fa7cd158327afcc99b6d97f62429cdbf2b1c7a)

[{'created': '2019-02-05 12:19:37.000000000', 'message': "Prune unused Galaxy roles during upgrade

The 'kayobe control host upgrade' command updates the installed Ansible Galaxy
roles based on requirements.yml. Sometimes roles are removed from that file,
but there is currently no way of removing them from the local system.

Normally this causes no problems, but due to the upstream role containing
symlinks with whitespace, we are switching out yatesr.timezone to a
stackhpc.timezone fork. In order to make upgrades work, we need to ensure the
old role is removed. It also makes sense to clean up old roles generally.

This change adds support for removing stale roles during control host upgrade,

commit_message:
Prune unused Galaxy roles during upgrade

The 'kayobe control host upgrade' command updates the installed Ansible Galaxy
roles based on requirements.yml. Sometimes roles are removed from that file,
but there is currently no way of removing them from the local system.

Normally this causes no problems, but due to the upstream role containing
symlinks with whitespace, we are switching out yatesr.timezone to a
stackhpc.timezone fork. In order to make upgrades work, we need to ensure the
old role is removed. It also makes sense to clean up old roles generally.

This change adds support for removing stale roles during control host upgrade,
currently including the following roles:

stackhpc.os-flavors
stackhpc.os-projects
stackhpc.parted-1.1
yatesr.timezone

Change-Id: I174c7e6f19cbefda56777229a2441bf6469c0982
Story: 2004252
Task: 29166

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-11 15:14:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix alarm-definition-list in Python 3

Python 3 uses unicode strings by default. This bug was caused by
attempting to join a byte string to a unicode string when running
with the Python 3 interpreter.

A unit test was added to reproduce the problem.

Whilst this fix allows alarm definitions to be listed, it doesn't
fix the formatting problem in Python 3. A better fix may be
to return unicode strings in Python 3 as part of a wider code
audit.

Story: 2004972
Task: 29427
Change-Id: Ib008ed2aacd93f499b15094cf5a7e1bb0bb50a1f
"}, {'created': '2019-02-11 15:25:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix alarm-definition-list in Python 3

Python 3 uses unicode strings by default. This bug was caused by
attempting to join a byte string to a unicode string when running
with the Python 3 interpreter.

A unit test was added to reproduce the problem.

Whilst this fix allows alarm definitions to be listed, it doesn't
fix the formatting problem in Python 3. A better fix may be
to return unicode strings in Python 3 as part of a wider code
audit.

Story: 2004972
Task: 29427
Change-Id: Ib008ed2aacd93f499b15094cf5a7e1bb0bb50a1f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix alarm-definition-list in Python 3

Python 3 uses unicode strings by default. This bug was caused by
attempting to join a byte string to a unicode string when running
with the Python 3 interpreter.

A unit test was added to reproduce the problem.

Whilst this fix allows alarm definitions to be listed, it doesn't
fix the formatting problem in Python 3. A better fix may be
to return unicode strings in Python 3 as part of a wider code
audit.

Story: 2004972
Task: 29427
Change-Id: Ib008ed2aacd93f499b15094cf5a7e1bb0bb50a1f

commit_message:
step2: flatten nova service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files
into a single file that performs the docker service installation
and configuration. With this patch the baremetal version of
nova has been removed.

Change-Id: Ia41a6adf9fda2d6be8f1b5ac57854381b7f92ce7

commit_message:
New job for sahara-scenario based on Python 3

Only sahara-scenario is executed using Python 3;
the deployment itself (devstack) still uses Python 2.

In order to ease the transition, add a venv-py2 tox target
that can be used by the sahara and python-saharaclient jobs
on the older branches to still use python2 when the main
venv will be switched to python3.
This venv is used to make sure that the old branches
are still using Python 2 regardless of the configuration
of sahara-tests-scenario.

After this change is merged, the scenario jobs on older branches
should be changed to explicitly use venv-py2. When this is
done, sahara-tests-scenario-runner-py3 can be removed and
sahara-tests-scenario can be switched to use venv-py3.

Change-Id: I379a993e45da842cea24e50afe84c89556c0e700

commit_message:
Adding a note regarding running  bindep per project

As I sadly found out yesterday, new users will have to
run bindep on each individual repo they clone if they wish
to build project documentation. This is obvious to those
who have been working on the project forever, but this was
my first new computer in 5 years and I was pretty stumped -
couldn't work out why I needed liberasure to build swift
docs but here we are.

Change-Id: I27fb8ed862f3c2dfafba5f2d916a8c99fce7ec10

commit_message:
Delete server before removing its host from aggregate

In change Icd227b807a78bd37a77fa547880780ff9edad1e8 we don't
allow to remove host from aggregate if the host has instances
on it.

Change-Id: I19861b2832f140eac0ad5397091a6333e2f40618
Related-Bug: #1782539

commit_message:
Synchronise with Kayobe

Pulls in configuration from Kayobe prior to cutting a stable/rocky
branch.

Change-Id: Id61bc95f88ddfca6ffc919bae7345704497e26c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 11:31:32.000000000', 'message': 'Stop running dump-config quietly

If Ansible fails to look up variable values, Kayobe exits and only
prints this unhelpful message:

    Kayobe playbook(s) ansible/dump-config.yml exited 2

This commit stops executing the dump-config playbook quietly, resulting
in a more helpful output. For example, when using the hashi_vault lookup
module without being authenticated, the error message becomes:

    FAILED! => {"msg": "An unhandled exception occurred while running the lookup plugin 'hashi_vault'. Error was a <class 'ansible.errors.AnsibleError'>, original message: No Vault Token specified"}

Change-Id: Ia5e33a940bc9c4207c5ea6753614908e47884f4b
Story: 2004934
Task: 29326

commit_message:
Print output of dump-config in case of errors

If Ansible fails to look up variable values, Kayobe exits and only
prints this unhelpful message:

    Kayobe playbook(s) ansible/dump-config.yml exited 2

With this commit, the output is captured and printed in case of errors.
For example, when using the hashi_vault lookup module without being
authenticated, the output includes:

    FAILED! => {"msg": "An unhandled exception occurred while running
    the lookup plugin 'hashi_vault'. Error was a <class
    'ansible.errors.AnsibleError'>, original message: No Vault Token
    specified"}

Change-Id: Ia5e33a940bc9c4207c5ea6753614908e47884f4b
Story: 2004934
Task: 29326

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 20:05:20.000000000', 'message': 'Force host_routes to be a list

In commit 055e2528720c8e4801ac97d7d48e1358aad87af4, we started pulling
the host_routes attribute out of the "addresses" output from the server
resource.

When using deployed-server with DeployedServerPortMap however,
host_routes is not guaranteed to be present within the output value (and
we didn't tell anyone to add it). Since it's not present, it defaults to
{}.

When this value is passed into a nic config template such as
single-nic-vlans/role.role.j2.yaml, it is used as a value to
list_concat_unique to concat host_routes with the route for
169.254.169.254. This causes Heat to fail with an error: "Incorrect
arguments: Items to concat must be lists.".

To fix the scenario where host_routes is not specified in
DeployedServerPortMap, we use a yaql expression to default the value to
[] if it's not already a list.

Change-Id: I6bffc302265c45a2363fa9e973e90ff0938eac5c
'}]
commit_message:
Force host_routes to be a list

In commit 055e2528720c8e4801ac97d7d48e1358aad87af4, we started pulling
the host_routes attribute out of the "addresses" output from the server
resource.

When using deployed-server with DeployedServerPortMap however,
host_routes is not guaranteed to be present within the output value (and
we didn't tell anyone to add it). Since it's not present, it defaults to
{}.

When this value is passed into a nic config template such as
single-nic-vlans/role.role.j2.yaml, it is used as a value to
list_concat_unique to concat host_routes with the route for
169.254.169.254. This causes Heat to fail with an error: "Incorrect
arguments: Items to concat must be lists.".

To fix the scenario where host_routes is not specified in
DeployedServerPortMap, we use a yaql expression to default the value to
[] if it's not already a list.

Change-Id: I6bffc302265c45a2363fa9e973e90ff0938eac5c

commit_message:
Use external centos7-rt if present

Depending on the environment we execute this we need different
configuration for the centos7-rt repo, like at RDO zuul ci we have to
use nodepool mirrors, this patch check for a centos7-rt repo and enables
it if it's not present just creates a default one

Change-Id: I630a399d95752b1fb1e30220a582ace8d7b97f18
Related-Bug: #1814872
(cherry picked from commit d313a060c80f5d97c49092eb695c335be102b473)

(8 comments)

Greetings!

I'm afraid we need more background information to understand why and the required mechanics changes necessary to solve the problem you seek to solve. That being said, we also have an additional deploy interface and yet another one in review at this time. Comments and concerns are in-line. Please let me know if I can be of any assistance. I can be reached on irc.freenode.net in #openstack-ironic as TheJulia.

Thanks,

-Julia"}, {'account_id': 22948, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:45:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-07-18 14:19:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (8 comments)
 > 
 > Greetings!
 > 
 > I'm afraid we need more background information to understand why
 > and the required mechanics changes necessary to solve the problem
 > you seek to solve. That being said, we also have an additional
 > deploy interface and yet another one in review at this time.
 > Comments and concerns are in-line. Please let me know if I can be
 > of any assistance. I can be reached on irc.freenode.net in
 > #openstack-ironic as TheJulia.
 > 
 > Thanks,
 > 
 > -Julia

@Julia so this change is WIP code to support the suggested ironic spec in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582767/. Basically we want to introduce a new flow in ironic for SmartNIC that we can run ovs and neutron ovs agent in it to get the same network features the neutorn ovs is doing to vms to do it for baremetal"}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-07-18 14:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 27: Code-Review-1

We have another patch in python-ironicclient that adds --is-smartnic param to port create command:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/629449/


As an example to create Smart NIC port:

openstack baremetal port create $HW_MAC_ADDRESS --node $NODE_UUID \
    --local-link-connection hostname=$HOSTNAME \
    --local-link-connection port_id=$REP_NAME \
    --pxe-enabled true \
    --physical-network physnet1 \
    --is-smartnic true

Refer to this list for all Smart NIC patches:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bluefield'}, {'account_id': 29271, 'date': '2019-01-30 08:02:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Add support for Smart NICs

Extend Ironic to enable use of Smart NICs to implement
generic networking services for baremetal servers.

Extending the ramdisk, direct, iscsi and ansible deployment Interfaces
to support the Smart NIC use-cases.

For Smart NIC use-case the baremetal node must be powered on and
booted into bios then wait for agent that runs on the Smart NIC to be
alive then do the network changes required.

Task: #26932
Story: #2003346
Change-Id: I00d6f13dd991074e4f45ada4d7cf4ccc0edbc7e1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-19 14:43:39.000000000', 'message': 'Remove -u root as mysql is executed with root user

As openstack installation guides suggest to run mysql with root shell
user, mysql will not ask for password, so in
controller-install-*.rst "-u root -p" is useless.

Change-Id: I4ecf6dc6d42d1baaf46a40b809cbfc267270121e
Related-Bug: #1785025
'}]
commit_message:
Remove -u root as mysql is executed with root user

As openstack installation guides suggest to run mysql with root shell
user, mysql will not ask for password, so in
controller-install-*.rst "-u root -p" is useless.

Change-Id: I4ecf6dc6d42d1baaf46a40b809cbfc267270121e
Related-Bug: #1785025

[{'account_id': 29639, 'date': '2018-12-07 14:55:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-12-07 14:56:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29639, 'date': '2018-12-07 15:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-12-07 15:46:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

subject: add debug option to  ceph mon or osd start command
messages:
[{'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2018-12-12 10:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2018-12-12 12:09:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think it's a good idea to ALWAYS debug. 
It produces a lot of logs, and it's the easiest way to run out of space on docker logs.
I would propose to base it on some variable."}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2018-12-12 14:12:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I don't think it's a good idea to ALWAYS debug.
 > It produces a lot of logs, and it's the easiest way to run out of
 > space on docker logs.
 > I would propose to base it on some variable.

like other projects，add a  ceph_debug variable?and this variable reference 
openstack_debug"}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2018-12-12 14:50:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2018-12-12 14:54:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I don't think it's a good idea to ALWAYS debug.
 > It produces a lot of logs, and it's the easiest way to run out of
 > space on docker logs.
 > I would propose to base it on some variable.

though ，i add a variable to control debug ,but i think this --d option just print to 'docker logs ceph_mon', will not print to log file, i don't know whether this  will  use disk space"}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2018-12-12 15:06:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > I don't think it's a good idea to ALWAYS debug.
 > > It produces a lot of logs, and it's the easiest way to run out of
 > > space on docker logs.
 > > I would propose to base it on some variable.
 > 
 > though ，i add a variable to control debug ,but i think this --d
 > option just print to 'docker logs ceph_mon', will not print to log
 > file, i don't know whether this  will  use disk space

Well, by default docker logs is using json-file docker logging backend - and from an operational experience - it can take up a lot of space, if you have a debug enabled container running for some time :)"}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2018-12-12 15:08:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
add debug option to  ceph mon or osd start command

when ceph_mon and ceph_osd start failed, add debug option will
print more info. now when ceph_mon and ceph_osd containers start
failed, docker logs ceph_mon print none log

Closes-Bug: #1815707

Change-Id: I3c5086019808a9738714f5279ec74cbb9b7a8587

'}, {'created': '2019-01-25 10:37:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for RADOS gateway multi-site replication

Add new radosgw-multisite typed master and slave relations to
support configuration of separate ceph-radosgw deployments as
a single realm and zonegroup to support replication of data
between distinct RADOS gateway deployments.

This mandates the use of the realm, zonegroup and zone
configuration options of which realm and zonegroup must match
between instances of the ceph-radosgw application participating
in the master/slave relation.

The radosgw-multisite relation may be deployed as a model local
relation or as a cross-model relation.

TODO

Complete unit tests:
    hooks
Functional test

Change-Id: I094f89b0f668e012482ca8aace1756c911b79d17
Closes-Bug: 1666880

commit_message:
Add support for RADOS gateway multi-site replication

Add new radosgw-multisite typed master and slave relations to
support configuration of separate ceph-radosgw deployments as
a single realm and zonegroup to support replication of data
between distinct RADOS gateway deployments.

This mandates the use of the realm, zonegroup and zone
configuration options of which realm and zonegroup must match
between instances of the ceph-radosgw application participating
in the master/slave relation.

The radosgw-multisite relation may be deployed as a model local
relation or as a cross-model relation.

Change-Id: I094f89b0f668e012482ca8aace1756c911b79d17
Closes-Bug: 1666880

We are starting to see some of the kolla build jobs timing out after 2

commit_message:
Bump kolla build job timeout to 2.5 hours

We are starting to see some of the kolla build jobs timing out after 2
hours. The timeout is within the testr test runner configuration rather
than the Zuul job configuration (which sets it to 3 hours).

This change bumps the default testr timeout to 2.5 hours.

Change-Id: Ie2b666dec9c2be0ff0957b488cf03862b4b07b02

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

I think if we use the schema, we have to bump the microversion for the new schema, and changing 404 to 400 don't need a microversion bump"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-06 01:09:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

As Kevin said, a new schema check would likely be a new microversion. I don't think the 404 -> 400 change is that big of a deal since this API already returned both error response codes. If people are concerned about the error response code changes, then I can leave it as a 404.

Probably best to get input from Ken'ichi, Alex and Ghanshyam."}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-12-06 07:15:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> Probably best to get input from Ken'ichi, Alex and Ghanshyam.

I also would like to hear their opinions."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-12-06 23:59:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I feel a new microversion bump is a little overkill for changing error code change.
In addition, jsonschema would be able to cover this case by using enum then the error code could be changed to HTTP400 as Zhenyu said.

My question here is why don't we put an input check before calling actual method. This new error handling is added on exception handling in _update() which is used from both _enable_disable() and _forced_down().
It would be readable and easy to add

 331         if service.binary != 'nova-compute':
 332             msg = (_('Updating a %(binary)s service is not supported. Only '
 333                      'nova-compute services can be updated.') %
 334                    {'binary': service.binary})
 335             raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg)

into these methods like update() I feel."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-07 19:52:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Ken'ichi, if I'm following you:

> My question here is why don't we put an input check before calling actual method. This new error handling is added on exception handling in _update() which is used from both _enable_disable() and _forced_down().

You're suggesting that instead of calling self.host_api.service_update(context, host, binary, payload) from the _update() method, simply do that binary check first and fail if it's not a nova-compute service? I could do that as well."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-07 19:55:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Otherwise yes we could restrict 'binary' in the schema to simply be 'nova-compute':

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620667/2/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/services.py

Which would generate the 400 error."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-07 19:57:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Note also this is an admin-only API by default so I'm less concerned about a 404->400 error code change here when these APIs could already return a 400."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-12-07 20:13:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Matt,

 > You're suggesting that instead of calling self.host_api.service_update(context, host, binary, payload) from the _update() method, simply do that binary check first and fail if it's not a nova-compute service?

Yeah, that is I wanted to say :)

And the other your points seem reasonable to allow us to change the error code without microversion bump."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-12-10 10:11:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Probably best to get input from Ken'ichi, Alex and Ghanshyam.
 > 
 > I also would like to hear their opinions.

It does not need microversion bump as it change the error code to 400 which is always existing returned error code from schema validation.
ref-  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/contributor/microversions.html#id3"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-12-10 10:16:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> Hi Matt,
 > 
 > > You're suggesting that instead of calling self.host_api.service_update(context,
 > host, binary, payload) from the _update() method, simply do that
 > binary check first and fail if it's not a nova-compute service?
 > 
 > Yeah, that is I wanted to say :)
 > 
 > And the other your points seem reasonable to allow us to change the
 > error code without microversion bump.

One question on doing it on schema or at upper level like in update() - we are changing the error code and msg when we get HostMappingNotFound exception for non-nova-compute service otherwise no. I do not know if it is always the case where updating non-nova-compute services with microversion <2.53 is always HostMappingNotFound. if not then, doing it in _update() after HostMappingNotFound catch is the right place to do.

otherwise, it can always return 400 even when requesting with <2.53.

current changes lgtm."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-12-10 10:18:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Hi Matt,
 > >
 > > > You're suggesting that instead of calling self.host_api.service_update(context,
 > > host, binary, payload) from the _update() method, simply do that
 > > binary check first and fail if it's not a nova-compute service?
 > >
 > > Yeah, that is I wanted to say :)
 > >
 > > And the other your points seem reasonable to allow us to change
 > the
 > > error code without microversion bump.
 >

 > update() - we are changing the error code and msg when we get
 > HostMappingNotFound exception for non-nova-compute service
 > otherwise no. I do not know if it is always the case where updating
 > non-nova-compute services with microversion <2.53 is always
 > HostMappingNotFound. if not then, doing it in _update() after
 > HostMappingNotFound catch is the right place to do.
 > 
 > otherwise, it can always return 400 even when requesting with
 > <2.53.
 > 
 > current changes lgtm.

once case is where binary is not found and it return HostBinaryNotFound in _update() which then return 404 to user. Doing it in schema or upper level can change this error code also."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-10 14:07:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I do not know if it is always the case where updating non-nova-compute services with microversion <2.53 is always HostMappingNotFound. if not then, doing it in _update() after HostMappingNotFound catch is the right place to do.

No HostMappingNotFound was not always the case, that changed in Pike when the API was made cells aware. Since then, for all microversions, you can't update non-compute services.

> otherwise, it can always return 400 even when requesting with <2.53.

Yes it's been this way since Pike."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-11 20:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2019-02-11 21:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-28 17:54:34.000000000', 'message': "Provide a useful error message when trying to update non-compute services

Starting in Pike, we disallowed trying to update (enable/disable/force down)
non-nova-compute services because of multi-cell support using host mappings
to lookup service records, and simply because disabling non-compute services
doesn't do anything.

However, before microversion 2.53, the error the user gets back is confusing:

  HTTP exception thrown: Host 'p024.domain.com' is not mapped to any cell

This change provides a useful error message in this case also also changes
the 404 response to a 400 response to align with the type of error and the
behavior of the 2.53 microversion.

Change-Id: I44f09aec60b0b18c458f9ba6d8b725db962e9cc7
Closes-Bug: #1805164
"}, {'created': '2018-11-28 23:45:40.000000000', 'message': "Provide a useful error message when trying to update non-compute services

Starting in Pike, we disallowed trying to update (enable/disable/force down)
non-nova-compute services because of multi-cell support using host mappings
to lookup service records, and simply because disabling non-compute services
doesn't do anything.

However, before microversion 2.53, the error the user gets back is confusing:

  HTTP exception thrown: Host 'p024.domain.com' is not mapped to any cell

This change provides a useful error message in this case and also changes
the 404 response to a 400 response to align with the type of error and the
behavior of the 2.53 microversion.

commit_message:
Provide a useful error message when trying to update non-compute services

Starting in Pike, we disallowed trying to update (enable/disable/force down)
non-nova-compute services because of multi-cell support using host mappings
to lookup service records, and simply because disabling non-compute services
doesn't do anything.

However, before microversion 2.53, the error the user gets back is confusing:

  HTTP exception thrown: Host 'p024.domain.com' is not mapped to any cell

This change provides a useful error message in this case and also changes
the 404 response to a 400 response to align with the type of error and the
behavior of the 2.53 microversion.

Change-Id: I44f09aec60b0b18c458f9ba6d8b725db962e9cc7
Closes-Bug: #1805164

DriverVolumeBlockDevice will delete volume attachment when attach
fails, in this case, nova.compute.manager will delete it again
and it will raise VolumeAttachmentNotFound exception. This outputs
an incorrect error log and this exception should be ignored.

commit_message:
Ignore VolumeAttachmentNotFound exception in compute.manager

DriverVolumeBlockDevice will delete volume attachment when attach
fails, codes link:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/907c7d2cf/nova/virt/block_device.py#L561-L568
However, nova.compute.manager will delete it again and it will raise
VolumeAttachmentNotFound exception. This outputs an incorrect error
log and this exception should be ignored.

Change-Id: I939c09e5b0efb3b17a9855af227e6d60c64d23e2
Closes-Bug: #1812969

[{'account_id': 26898, 'date': '2018-12-17 13:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-12-17 13:47:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-12-18 06:07:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Unfortunately we can't really do this without breaking existing users' templates.

One option would be to add a new property, deprecate the old one, and look at both. It seems a bit like overkill for this though."}, {'account_id': 26898, 'date': '2018-12-19 14:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-12-19 14:46:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 26898, 'date': '2018-12-19 15:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for your review.

I got some issues with this heat ressource. The tenant_id attribute doesn't exist on LBaaSv2 API (https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/?expanded=create-a-load-balancer-detail#create-a-load-balancer).

When you create a LoadBalancer with it, Heat returns an error like "tenant_id attribute doesn't exist".

Should i create new "bug" on StoryBoard ?

If you want, I can leave tenant_id and translate it to project_id before passing it to neutron client'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-12-19 21:40:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hmm, so are you saying that this has *never* worked? Or did the API change at some point?

> If you want, I can leave tenant_id and translate it to project_id before passing it to neutron client

+1, let's do that initially because it's a change we'll need to backport by the sounds of it. (And yes, please do open a storyboard story, it'll help us track any backports.)

But also it probably does make sense to deprecate that property and add a new project_id one if that has always been the API. (This can't be backported though, so we'd want to do it in a separate patch.) Adding a property translation rule can help ease that transition."}, {'account_id': 26898, 'date': '2018-12-20 15:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26898, 'date': '2018-12-20 16:02:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

A new story was created here : https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2004650
This resource should not work since Pike release (tenant_id seems to be removed during pike release).'}, {'account_id': 28595, 'date': '2018-12-22 13:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-01-02 03:18:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-01-03 04:16:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

> Hmm, so are you saying that this has *never* worked?

I guess that's the case with octavia v2 api. May be we should remove the tenant_id properties from the other octavia resources (listener, pool etc) in this patch or a followup, as it uses the one from loadbalancer[1]. Would get the same error, if someone tries to specify tenant_id in those.

May be we also need a generic way to translate TENANT_ID property with a translation rule for all resource plugins?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/2deadd3f83bf55c1061623839ddad97b86c62b12/octavia/api/v2/controllers/listener.py#L198"}, {'account_id': 26898, 'date': '2019-02-13 13:15:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-02-14 11:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

'}, {'created': '2018-11-30 21:50:44.000000000', 'message': "Add region tests for system member role

From keystone's perspective, the ``member`` and ``reader`` roles are
effectively the same, isolating writable region operations to the
system ``admin`` role.

This commit adds explicit testing to make sure the ``member`` role
is allowed to perform readable and not writable mapping operations.
Subsequent patches will incorporate:

 - system admin functionality
 - domain user test coverage
 - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I2253288574fc6b932a5c57bfee8f176e3d10dd84
Related-Bug: 1804292
Related-Bug: 1804446
"}, {'created': '2018-12-07 18:16:36.000000000', 'message': "Add region tests for system member role

effectively the same, isolating writable region operations to the
system ``admin`` role.

This commit adds explicit testing to make sure the ``member`` role

commit_message:
Add region tests for system member role

From keystone's perspective, the ``member`` and ``reader`` roles are
effectively the same, isolating writable region operations to the
system ``admin`` role.

This commit adds explicit testing to make sure the ``member`` role
is allowed to perform readable and not writable mapping operations.
Subsequent patches will incorporate:

 - system admin functionality
 - domain user test coverage
 - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I2253288574fc6b932a5c57bfee8f176e3d10dd84
Related-Bug: 1804292
Related-Bug: 1804446

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Idcf383c2a734d240aa4ab7864bde814face4402c
Story: #2004073
Task: #27422

commit_message:
Use only a single worker process

Reduce the control plane's memory footprint by limiting the number of
OpenStack worker processes to one per-service.

Story: 2004704
Task: 28733
(cherry picked from commit 5bcad3c90e4b7b7c11d09709fcaaf959b308a039)

commit_message:
Automatically enable serial consoles on post configure

This functionality is controlled by the flag ironic_serial_console_autoenable,
which, when enabled, will configure serial consoles for each of the ironic
nodes during the `overcloud post configure` step. This was added to reduce the
number of kayobe commands that are needed to be run for a given deployment.

Change-Id: I7072e518c29387b964e4e25b08b4559f152d5ecf
Story: 2004192
Task: 29325

commit_message:
Add heat user to heat domain admin role

Currently in rocky, due to the fact we replaced
the ansible keystone plugin, the heat user is
not being added in the heat domain, which causes
issues for example to magnum to create stacks and
nodes. This role is stated in the heat openstack
installation docs.

This patch aims to implemente the role assignment

Depends-On: I2fbb2465f9b4765a87011dfb2c2f65bd27e7b2c9 

Change-Id: Ib65a12990059f8125caff279622d89643bcc2fd5
(cherry picked from commit 2c0323c9efa2d3b95a4d264ea9dc0e5155250ca9)

commit_message:
Drop keystone integration for PKI token format

The PKI token format is no longer supported by the keystone charm;
drop code, tests and associated template fragments which deal with
configuration of PKI revocation list processing.

Change-Id: Ie08779c2aef15589b621c324808bb13089fb4f72
Closes-Bug: 1586550

commit_message:
Revert "Backport tox.ini to switch to stestr"

This reverts commit 5939ae995fdeb2746346ebd81ce223e4fe891c85,
which changed dependencies for the stable/pike branch. It's a
general policy to not change dependencies in stable branches,
therefore it is being reverted.

Change-Id: Ic8e42f2c18d7d78b3c6035f27297319e93267cd6
Closes-Bug: #1806079

commit_message:
Notify not only cinder service, but also Apache

Apache needs to be notified as well in case the API is being served in
that context, otherwise config changes would not take effect without
manual intervention.

Change-Id: If5e7c14d59843ee7c813eb1df8d7131e002dbd22
(cherry picked from commit 2cd58b8fb0799d2c00a35545daa0eaae2a5b2bc5)

commit_message:
Use processed bool as key in introspection_data DB table

When using store_data=database with sqlalchemy, running introspection results
in a DBDuplicateEntry error.  This happens because the query when adding an
entry uses both the primary key (uuid) and the processed flag, but the
processed flag is not a key.  This change makes it a key so that both
unprocessed and processed data can be stored in the table.

Note - since the previous migration hasn't been released yet this fixes it
without creating a new one.

Change-Id: I052594d529ae363fce50b1726169d86583bb1439
Story: #2004992
Task: #29463

commit_message:
do not compress files during installation

- this is required only when enabled for the entire dashboard,
  which is optional
- other plugins do not run compress at install time
- this is cpu intensive and will increase installation time,
  users can always run this if compression is required

without this currently
$ time zypper in -y openstack-horizon-plugin-heat-ui >> /dev/null
real 3m30.243s
user 2m2.136s
sys 0m41.399s

Change-Id: I061003197a94dfb4b3d3f1a16e850ef097e1d7da

commit_message:
Add the deployment guide job to our standard templates

The deployment guide has not been updated since the removal of the job
template. This change adds that job back to our standard templates which
will get the deployment guide publishing once again.

Change-Id: Ida9a8d60928b2bd03d2def0871fa059927c9509f
Signed-off-by: cloudnull <kevin@cloudnull.com>

- kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source job is failing

commit_message:
Fix py35/py36 and k-a-ubuntu-source gate jobs

- py35/py36 jobs are failing
python 3.6 pycache also includes links - so those also
need to be removed by tox testenv

- kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source job is failing
Without basedir set in galera.cnf - mysql_install_db looks for resolveip
in /usr/sbin, instead of /usr/bin, thus complains about cannot resolving
neither $HOSTNAME, nor localhost.

Change-Id: I40514c0a7c43ae01c7680aac81123942be1cdef9

commit_message:
On SUSE-based systems, check whether we have mariadb or mysql service

Older mariadb packages on SLES 12 provided mysql.service.  The newer
ones on SLES 12 and 15 use mariadb.service; they also provide a
mysql.service symlink for backwards-compatibility, but let's not rely
on that.

Change-Id: Ife6bd007ba30af0b77d44832b19d518034bdb12b

commit_message:
Change config-file to config-dir for g-api start

The glance-api service may use multiple config files, so
tell oslo.config about the config dir instead of a specific
config file when the service is started.

Change-Id: Iad3602d209cbb31e10683c67e1fd6b465d19f560
Partial-bug: #1805765

commit_message:
Glance should not reference Cinder v1

Cinder v1 was removed over a year ago.  Change the cinder template
URLs devstack defines in the glance-api.conf to use cinder v3
instead.

Change-Id: I4a68dc0b53631be0708e7411c37619dd6dfd4fa6

commit_message:
Stop creating the cinderv1 endpoint

The cinder v1 api is disabled by default,
the catalog entry is confusing.

Change-Id: Ifea283d8aff9f7a70b68d601c5225c3d4fe250e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-12 16:30:57.000000000', 'message': "tox: Don't write byte code (maybe)

In tox versions after 3.0.0rc1 [1], setting the environment variable
PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE will cause tox not to write .pyc files, which
means you don't have to delete them, which makes things faster.

In older tox versions, the env var is ignored.

If we bump the minimum tox version to something later than 3.0.0rc1, we
can remove the commands that find and remove .pyc files.

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/commit/336f4f6bd8b53223f940fc5cfc43b1bbd78d4699

Change-Id: I779a17afade78997ab084909a9e6a46b0f91f055
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Don't write byte code (maybe)

In tox versions after 3.0.0rc1 [1], setting the environment variable
PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE will cause tox not to write .pyc files, which
means you don't have to delete them, which makes things faster.

In older tox versions, the env var is ignored.

If we bump the minimum tox version to something later than 3.0.0rc1, we
can remove the commands that find and remove .pyc files.

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/commit/336f4f6bd8b53223f940fc5cfc43b1bbd78d4699

Change-Id: I779a17afade78997ab084909a9e6a46b0f91f055

 > http://logs.openstack.org/20/629420/3/gate/neutron-functional/c4e2f84/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-25_17_15_08_136141

Yes, and unfortunately it looks that it will still happen from time to time: http://logstash.openstack.org/#/dashboard/file/logstash.json?query=message:%5C%22bug%201687027%5C%22 but this isn't related to neutron tests or code. It is rather related to some cloud providers or some overloaded nodes sometimes.

And now we have to decide what we want: recheck patch from time to time when this issue occurs, or have those tests marked as unstable which may cause that we will not find other, real issue when it will be there."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-02-14 10:13:54.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Let's try something different: https://review.openstack.org/636892"}]

commit_message:
Revert "Mark mysql related functional tests as unstable"

This reverts commit b75cf8743cb4231c3a9bf9a34a58a083924ccf3b.

It looks that timeouts which we are spotting from time to time are just
related to hosts on which job is running and we can't do too much with
it.

So lets check how it will work now and if this will not be very common
that we will have such timeouts, lets unmark those tests to not
hide some other errors.

Change-Id: I80be4d95df18d98435d6bdff620386fdde2f08b8
Related-bug: #1687027

Release cinderclient 3.1.1

Note: even though this release includes a global requirements
update, only the patch version is being incremented because a
3.2.0 has already been released for the queens series.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-08 14:46:00.000000000', 'message': 'Update process to account for Stein changes

During the Stein cycle we introduced three process changes:

- no longer forcing releases around milestones for
  cycle-with-milestones deliverables, and autogenerating RC1
  release requests [0]

- triggering releases for libraries at every milestone if
  they had changes that were not otherwise released since
  the previous milestone [1]

- switching cycle-with-intermediary services to cycle-with-rc
  if they did not do any intermediary release by milestone-2 [2]

We failed to update process accordingly. These changes add a couple
of steps in the release process, and makes a few other irrelevant.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-September/135088.html
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135689.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000465.html

Change-Id: Id53275e73bc19418307d7197d7c2f29c09b0233c
'}]
commit_message:
Update process to account for Stein changes

During the Stein cycle we introduced three process changes:

- no longer forcing releases around milestones for
  cycle-with-milestones deliverables, and autogenerating RC1
  release requests [0]

- triggering releases for libraries at every milestone if
  they had changes that were not otherwise released since
  the previous milestone [1]

- switching cycle-with-intermediary services to cycle-with-rc
  if they did not do any intermediary release by milestone-2 [2]

We failed to update process accordingly. These changes add a couple
of steps in the release process, and makes a few other irrelevant.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-September/135088.html
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135689.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000465.html

Change-Id: Id53275e73bc19418307d7197d7c2f29c09b0233c

commit_message:
Add new DB schema: sqlachemy and alembic scripts.

Add the implementation of spec(https://review.openstack.org/615462)
This patch only contains new DB schema: sqlachemy and migration
scripts parts, and still lost object and model api parts of all tables
which will be submitted in the following patches. The initial owners
of remaining implementation are zhenghao, yumeng and Coco. This patch
delete the old unit test of object and api, we will add new unit test
once all ovos are ready.

Change-Id: I280b093076c8131a2ab2c925d3e050915a28977b

commit_message:
Switch httpboot directory for baremetal underclouds

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575003/ landed in tripleoclient
the path for baremetal underclouds will be broken, so switch this back

Then a config like:

containerized_undercloud: false
undercloud_install_cli_options: " --use-heat false"

Should be possible when falling back to the now deprecated instack install
undercloud.

Change-Id: I0899b0495490a0ea9b5d3926afe977a2d4f90539

commit_message:
Spec: Add some details to state management

CloudKitty is becoming more and more generic, at all levels. Now that scopes
can be anything, and can even be different when several collectors are running
with different configurations, some more details should be added ot the storage
state management.

Change-Id: If88fd4bbddba78b2dd36e234e25757dc028cb891
Story: 2004957
Task: 29388

commit_message:
get_parser() should return a parser

This is also breaking other cliff commands (e.g. complete) that rely on
the method returning a parser as expected rather than None.

Change-Id: If145c18e1664c16d0eba49a9ac334b1e97abdb5a

subject: Add agent_updated to BgpDrAgentNotifyApi notifier
messages:
[{'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-01-17 12:04:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2019-01-18 09:57:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

recheck Odd import error in functional test job, not sure why so let's see if it's transient"}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2019-01-18 12:36:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The functional job fails with the following import error:

File "/opt/stack/new/neutron-dynamic-routing/.tox/dsvm-functional/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/neutron/db/_resource_extend.py", line 18, in <module>
    from neutron_lib.db import resource_extend
ImportError: cannot import name resource_extend"

This import error doesn't line up with https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/stable/rocky/neutron/db/_resource_extend.py#L18. Maybe I'm missing something, but it seems like stable/rocky neutron isn't being pulled in, it looks like something newer. I don't think this patch actually is problematic, on the surface it looks like a CI issue or something silly with a requirements file...... Anyway, this doesn't make sense to me.'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-01-18 17:36:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

http://logs.openstack.org/75/631475/1/check/neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-functional/02a8ff8/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-18_10_09_04_622679

This installs neutron==14.0.0.0b1 (aka Stein beta), it should pull in Rocky version with the siblings "magic" system: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-sibling-setup (there is a section in that doc about stable branches setup)'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-01-22 09:57:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I read through the etherpad and check all the links in there to see if I could understand what is needed.

Didn't quite get what was required, but checked through most of it in neutron-dynamic-routing and couldn't see anything that could have caused it being missing.

I proposed [1] to see if it solves it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632330/"}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-13 11:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-13 14:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add agent_updated to BgpDrAgentNotifyApi notifier

When a bgp-dragent is deployed with enable_new_services
set to False so that the agent is disabled upon creation
the first attempt to enable it again throws an error but
the second time works, see the bug report.

Change-Id: If77e2035d0c12d0391ab9c38054bf2e0d24dac4a
Closes-Bug: 1799455
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632330/
(cherry picked from commit a861327795a10f51d3c80cce65d45812321a893f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-25 13:22:54.000000000', 'message': 'Call placement after instance delete

Blazar called placement to delete reservation inventory on reservation
resource provider *before* blazar asks nova to delete the instance.
This caused inventory in use 409 conflict error in placement.

This patch re-orders it to call placement after instance delete not to
cause the error.

Change-Id: I3b4a892a783140b4a25810aeed71c79f6207e155
Closes-Bug: #1813252
'}, {'created': '2019-01-27 04:22:56.000000000', 'message': 'Call placement after instance delete

Blazar called placement to delete reservation inventory on reservation
resource provider *before* blazar asks nova to delete the instance.
This caused inventory in use 409 conflict error in placement.

This patch re-orders it to call placement after instance delete not to
cause the error.

Change-Id: I3b4a892a783140b4a25810aeed71c79f6207e155
Partial-Bug: #1813252
'}, {'created': '2019-01-27 14:00:07.000000000', 'message': 'Call placement after instance delete

Blazar called placement to delete reservation inventory on reservation
resource provider *before* blazar asks nova to delete the instance.
This caused inventory in use 409 conflict error in placement.

This patch re-orders it to call placement after instance delete and

error.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633408/

commit_message:
Call placement after instance delete

Blazar called placement to delete reservation inventory on reservation
resource provider *before* blazar asks nova to delete the instance.
This caused inventory in use 409 conflict error in placement.

This patch re-orders it to call placement after instance delete and
adds a function to ensure the deletion is completed not to cause the
error.

Change-Id: I3b4a892a783140b4a25810aeed71c79f6207e155
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633408/
Closes-Bug: #1813252

commit_message:
Fix synchronization failure of acl rules 

Fix the problem of parameters mismatch of acl rule between neutron
and nb, in the process  of neutron and ovn's db synchronization
(nb's acl has more 'severity' and 'name' attributes),
resulting in wrong synchronization.The cmd of synchronization
is 'neutron-ovn-db-sync-util --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf
--config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini
--ovn-neutron_sync_mode repair'

Change-Id: I073af5dec374152c7b0004b734dbf28ab300167b

commit_message:
Fix acl rule synchronization failure

Fix the problem of parameters mismatch of acl rule between neutron 
and nb, in the process  of neutron and ovn's db synchronization 
(nb's acl has more 'severity' and 'name' attributes),
resulting in wrong synchronization.The cmd of synchronization
is 'neutron-ovn-db-sync-util --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf
--config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini
--ovn-neutron_sync_mode repair'

Change-Id: I2c69d220d262a02aa162d923245a095bb2cf3e46

commit_message:
Wait before lease status transition

Supporting placement API, on reservation end, there could be a time lag
between the server deletion and the lease status transition.

This change inserts a waiting function before checking the lease status.

Change-Id: Ia39a8691f799ac3cd654a0af5f1930eb58093a0d
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633203/

commit_message:
Fix MariaDB deployment on Ubuntu

Without basedir set in galera.cnf - mysql_install_db looks for resolveip
in /usr/sbin, instead of /usr/bin, thus complains about cannot resolving
neither $HOSTNAME, nor localhost.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/636750/
Change-Id: I4c52e6e0658f03c633d3a3adef48d2f5c967ae1b

[{'created': '2019-02-05 21:12:04.000000000', 'message': 'Update install docs to match default NFS config

nfs_shares_config default is "nfs_shares" but install doc instructed to
use "nfsshares". Following the documented instructions would work, but
we should use the default config value.

Closes-bug: #1716987

Change-Id: Ia5fb7a43cd47ed8fdd3e561affd9c3af95e6b40b

commit_message:
Update install docs to match default NFS config

nfs_shares_config default is "nfs_shares" but install doc instructed to
use "nfsshares". Following the documented instructions would work, but
we should use the default config value.

Closes-bug: #1716987

Change-Id: Ia5fb7a43cd47ed8fdd3e561affd9c3af95e6b40b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update in-VM links, bookmarks and help

This patch brings a better in-VM experience to attendees of the upstream
training, with fixed links and README and a default opening page of
firefox that points to the rendered version of the README.

The firefox places sqlite database is also removed and the
git-compatible text version is included so updating links would be
easier in the future.

Pip packaage list also updated (2019-02-13)

Change-Id: I0849df7a09d94d5d8118c87da9b2f1b2210b1c25

commit_message:
Add Project Information column in table

This patch add 'Project' column in volume-group table to the
admin volume group panel.Now user would be able to list that
group is created by admin or demo user.

Change-Id: I5e4837a1a03b50bd6121aa0ab019829fd4a79dbb

commit_message:
Prioritize sloppy nodes for power sync

When scheduling nodes for periodic power sync, first deal with
the nodes that used to fail power syncing in the near past.

The aim here is to fail non-responsive nodes fast.

Change-Id: Id7f654369843c28b5edc213046f82c7bf15fed85

It's late so I'm not trying, but if running under tox, is it sufficient to set this in my shell, or do I have to do it in the setenv of the appropriate tox.ini section?"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-02-13 23:50:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Good.
 > 
 > It's late so I'm not trying, but if running under tox, is it
 > sufficient to set this in my shell, or do I have to do it in the
 > setenv of the appropriate tox.ini section?

It's sufficient to set it in the shell, i.e. 'OS_DEBUG=1 tox -efunctional test_stuff'."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-13 23:52:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> It's sufficient to set it in the shell, i.e. 'OS_DEBUG=1 tox -efunctional test_stuff'.

Thanks Mel. I recently noticed that was *not* the case for something else, trying to remember what.

Oh, it was PYTHONHASHSEED, but I think we figured out that that wasn't actually having any effect on the symptom at hand no matter where you set it."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-02-14 00:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Document how to make tests log at DEBUG level

OS_DEBUG is a handy trick, so let's make it slightly more
discoverable.

Change-Id: I02e4fbffc3c2c4f5b2737a44581ba7168f3a0d0f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-01 02:13:14.000000000', 'message': 'Search ports with matching subnet

On ipam_request_address, it will try to find existing Neutron
ports if any. If there is no existing Neutron ports, kuryr will
create one. Kuryr will search ports with matching IP address first.
If the first search is not successful, it will do a second search
to find ports with matching mac address.
This commit improve the second search by matching the subnet_id
as well as the mac address. This is because things will go wrong
if the port is in a different subnet (e.g. an ipv6 address is
requested while the port is in a v4 subnet).

Change-Id: I1eaa9c87079f1c57babbe08ae52ed69a44cfa9aa
Related-Bug: #1800375
(cherry picked from commit 542cb5aabd73a7bf9865dacd68f484aea49ae71e)
'}]
commit_message:
Search ports with matching subnet

On ipam_request_address, it will try to find existing Neutron
ports if any. If there is no existing Neutron ports, kuryr will
create one. Kuryr will search ports with matching IP address first.
If the first search is not successful, it will do a second search
to find ports with matching mac address.
This commit improve the second search by matching the subnet_id
as well as the mac address. This is because things will go wrong
if the port is in a different subnet (e.g. an ipv6 address is
requested while the port is in a v4 subnet).

Change-Id: I1eaa9c87079f1c57babbe08ae52ed69a44cfa9aa
Related-Bug: #1800375
(cherry picked from commit 542cb5aabd73a7bf9865dacd68f484aea49ae71e)

openstack/xstatic-angular-lrdragndrop has a 1.0.2.3 tag,but it was

in PyPI and git.

messages:
[{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-12-19 11:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-12-19 11:07:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Needs some decisions before it can be merged'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-12-19 12:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sounds good to me to get new releases for consistency but I need to test horizon with new packages first'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-12-19 12:12:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-12-19 12:12:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-09 09:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Ivan Did you have a chance to test those new versions of packages ?'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-01-29 18:49:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

This change should not break Horizon, so I'm OK with it"}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-01-29 18:52:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I tested Horizon with the mentioned xstatic-* versions and it works for me. I hope I didn't miss anything that can break Horizon. I suppose no Horizo plugin will be affected"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-02-08 16:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-02-11 13:59:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-02-11 15:04:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-02-11 15:12:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-11 21:01:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I have several questions related to this change.

- What happens when we add entries related to existing tags to YAML files? Is it just to add information to the files and does no further processing like PyPI publishing happen?
- I see several PyPI packages without tags in the repositories (examples: xstatic-mdi, xstatic-jasmine). Is there any way to add information (like tags) to the repositories?'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-02-12 09:45:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

- Adding releases in the YAML corresponding to existing tags will not trigger anything, it just provides past documentation on releases.openstack.org.

- It is very inconvenient to retrospectively add tags for manual releases on PyPI, since the tags trigger all the release automation. After discussing with Ivan, we agreed to sync PyPI status with tags in the git repositories by doing a few new releases (see https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:horizon-history )'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-12 10:54:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thanks for clarification. I now clearly understand what will happen.
In addition, some new releases of xstatic-* deliverables make sense to me.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-12 10:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:31:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Looks okay to me, but I'd like to see someone else confirm first."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:36:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-02-14 06:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks everyone!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-19 11:06:51.000000000', 'message': 'Import missing release history for xstatic-*

Some xstatic deliverables were released in the past but their
tag history was never imported in this repository.

Before we can merge this, we might want to resolve inconsistencies
between most recently-available on Pypi and repo tags:

https://pypi.org/project/XStatic-mdi has 1.4.57.0
openstack/xstatic-mdi has a 1.6.50.1 that was never uploaded.
Should we post a 1.6.50.2 to sync our tags with Pypi ? Would
that push a potentially-undesirable update ?

https://pypi.org/project/XStatic-Jasmine has 2.4.1.1
openstack/jasmine does not have that tag. Should we create it ?
Maybe as 2.4.1.2 to trigger a new upload ?

https://pypi.org/project/XStatic-Angular-lrdragndrop has 1.0.2.2
openstack/xstatic-angular-lrdragndrop has a 1.0.2.3 tag that was
never uploaded. Should we post a 1.0.2.4 to sync our tags with
Pypi ? Would that push a potentially-undesirable update ?

https://pypi.org/project/XStatic-Magic-Search has 0.2.5.1
openstack/xstatic-magic-search does not have that tag. Should we
create it ? Maybe as 0.2.5.2 to trigger a new upload ?
Alternatively, since XStatic-Magic-Search is not in global
requirements (and not in recent horizon requirements.txt either)
maybe we should just deprecate that repo?

Change-Id: I782107742758c99bd9d1dd692fca6ba6d826e2a3

Some xstatic deliverables were released in the past but their
tag history was never imported in this repository.

Furthermore some were uploaded to PyPI directly, without tagging.
We should trigger new releases to ensure the latest is in both
git tags and PyPI.

https://pypi.org/project/XStatic-mdi has 1.4.57.0
openstack/xstatic-mdi has a 1.6.50.1 that was never uploaded.
Let's do a 1.6.50.2 release so that we get the same in PyPI and git.

trigger a new upload and get the same in PyPI and git.

never uploaded. Let's do a 1.0.2.4 release so that we get the same
in PyPI and git.

openstack/xstatic-magic-search does not have that tag. Let's do a
0.2.5.2 to trigger a new upload and get the same in PyPI and git.

commit_message:
Cleanup old MariaDB cruft from override file

Kolla is switching to MariaDB package provided by RDO instead of
mariadb.org. We do not need to overwrite the package names in our
overrides file anymore.

Change-Id: Iabaa9f0d2b9a8622a01a2d434311c44aac4d0d70
Depends-On: I071362fc1b8d60199a77e2fe0475d2b4c3b5341b
(cherry picked from commit 8c56f23bec1241bbf76ca440620bca03c2fd8a7c)

[{'created': '2019-02-13 20:11:45.000000000', 'message': "Drop specific versions of openSUSE-based distributions

In the contributor documentation, don't reference specific
distribution versions since they'll inevitably get out of date, and
these instructions are valid for all releases in the last 5 years at
least, and are not likely to change any time soon.

Change-Id: I7e7391a8850cf8a9dda763d9b85242fbbbb42af7
"}]
commit_message:
Drop specific versions of openSUSE-based distributions

In the contributor documentation, don't reference specific
distribution versions since they'll inevitably get out of date, and
these instructions are valid for all releases in the last 5 years at
least, and are not likely to change any time soon.

Change-Id: I7e7391a8850cf8a9dda763d9b85242fbbbb42af7

[{'created': '2019-01-31 12:11:57.000000000', 'message': 'Make keepalived configuration future-proof

As keepalived, from v2.0.0, uses execev() instead
of system() for running scripts, the haproxy_check
and the pingable_check will fail when upgrading
keepalived. Exporting the full command into scripts
make them compatibale with newer version of keepalived.

Change-Id: Iea7d4565910046149d64dd1b4d8ec7bebb6e9e2a
Closes-bug: #1814064
'}]
commit_message:
Make keepalived configuration future-proof

As keepalived, from v2.0.0, uses execev() instead
of system() for running scripts, the haproxy_check
and the pingable_check will fail when upgrading
keepalived. Exporting the full command into scripts
make them compatibale with newer version of keepalived.

Change-Id: Iea7d4565910046149d64dd1b4d8ec7bebb6e9e2a
Closes-bug: #1814064

commit_message:
Fix functional tests

Manila's ci scripts disable configuring the
default share and share group types if testing
with the dummy driver.

We want to continue using the the default types
mechanism in python-manilaclient, until we decide
not to.

Change-Id: I14544bea728286eeb33461e724d991fe556a4269
Closes-Bug: #1787292

commit_message:
Ensure create a volume from image

openstack docs[1] that allows an user to create a volume
from an image

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/blockstorage-volume-backed-image.html

Change-Id: Iefdaf569dfdab4e28a8fe41a0846d103b5a7ce23
Closes-Bug: 1812185

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-14 10:16:32.000000000', 'message': "Only implement policy.json if an override is configured

With I810b6cb6bba2d95cc5bb477d6e2968ac1734c96b merged there
is no longer a default policy.json file in the venv, so we
need to change how we implement the file, and should only do
so if there is a config override configured for it.

If there is no policy override configured, but a policy.json
file is present, then it's likely left over from a previous
build. To ensure that we do not carry legacy configuration
files which override the policy-in-code we remove the legacy
file. This is done on restart to ensure that the policy still
applies until the code is updated.

Change-Id: Ib3447cd5b0bcada4cdf82d9e4a9fe5160299f9c3
(cherry picked from commit 7c90daa9097f816aac797a0d93cabff23bdd7edd)
"}]
commit_message:
Only implement policy.json if an override is configured

With I810b6cb6bba2d95cc5bb477d6e2968ac1734c96b merged there
is no longer a default policy.json file in the venv, so we
need to change how we implement the file, and should only do
so if there is a config override configured for it.

If there is no policy override configured, but a policy.json
file is present, then it's likely left over from a previous
build. To ensure that we do not carry legacy configuration
files which override the policy-in-code we remove the legacy
file. This is done on restart to ensure that the policy still
applies until the code is updated.

Change-Id: Ib3447cd5b0bcada4cdf82d9e4a9fe5160299f9c3
(cherry picked from commit 7c90daa9097f816aac797a0d93cabff23bdd7edd)

commit_message:
Set binding:host_id on creating/updating port

This patch depends on a change on kuryr-libnetwork [1],
which skip populating 'binding:host_id' if it is already
populated. This commit leverages the kuryr's change and
has the 'binding:host_id' filled.

This effectively moves a neutron API call from kuryr
to zun but it increases the performance since docker
daemon are blocked if the slow API call is in kuryr side.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627198/

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627198/
Partial-Bug: #1809306

commit_message:
Use :oslo-config: role in hypervisor-kvm doc

Convert ``option`` to the shiny :oslo.config:option:`section.option`
format in admin/configuration/hypervisore-kvm.

Recognizing this could be done to a lot more files; I just happened to
be looking at this one today.

Change-Id: If1b02ce99152ffd00d4f461dc4539606db1bb13b

commit_message:
Update help messages for weight multipliers

This patch is a follow-up for
I79e191010adbc0ec0ed02c9d589106debbf90ea8.

Update help messages for the following weight multiplier
config options.

* soft_affinity_weight_multiplier
* soft_anti_affinity_weight_multiplier

Change-Id: I2ea7becc3ea6a19f8c360f3d84ff7ae22511437b
